Review Contents: Okay, I got these to watch tv in the next room when my wife and I are watching separate shows. They paired easily with the transmitter on the tv and sounded very nice. They are comfortable and really do a good job of blocking out other noise when turned up a little. It still held the signal as I would walk to the kitchen (aprx. 20 feet}. There is a very slight hum when there is no volume which is why I give it 4 stars. I didn't notice it at all when volume is up. I am very happy with my headphones.
Title: They paired easily with the transmitter on the tv and sounded very ...

Review Contents: Purchased as a 2017 Christmas gift for my teen daughter, she loves them, can't get her attention half the time now. She thinks the charge intervals are longer than whats stated. She says they are comfortable for long periods over her ears.
Title: She says they are comfortable for long periods over her ears

Review Contents: Great over ear headphones. Easy to stay on as I'm working out. The sound is clear and loud. I can answer the phone as well which I love. My only issue is you have to hold the power button for about 10 seconds or so before they turn off or on. Otherwise they are very good headphones for the price.
Title: Decent headphones

Review Contents: The strongest feature was the comfortable earmuffs, so prolonged use won't hurt your ears. Overall, very fast and easy to use and it is built very well. I showed this to a friend and they guessed it is worth $100 when its only $37. There is no active noise cancelling but the muffs surround your ears which is passive cancelling and it really does make a difference. I have considered other wireless headphones for $50ish but I decided to go with this one because of the price and its features.
Title: Best bang for buck

Review Contents: They arrived and looked great and sounded great when plugged into my computer, the problem is with the Bluetooth mode. I have a high end brand new computer that runs windows 10 and  when in Bluetooth mode the headphone sound cuts in and out so badly that you can not even really use it in Bluetooth mode. I sent them back to Amazon and will try one more time just in case I got a bad headphone or a lemon....I was impressed with the sound and the headphones in the plugged in mode though. But I bought them specifically for the Bluetooth feature.
Title: Bluetooth did not work properly

Review Contents: Good value.  The "noise isolating" that they advertise is pretty much non-existent, but what can you really expect for something this inexpensive!  They are comfortable and work good overall.
Title: Good value. The "noise isolating" that they advertise is ...

Review Contents: These headphones are amazing. I got them because I have Misophonia and work in a cubicle type setting. My coworkers talk loud, crackle bags, chew loud, clip nails, and various other noises that annoy me. My ear buds didn't do the trick. These headphones make it so I can't hear anything else. My coworkers tested this by raising their voices at me and I couldn't hear it. They fold easy and are very comfortable. Easy to pair with phone and easy to pause and control volume. And the price is amazing. No complaints here. Except I'd love a pink version lol.
Title: Great for Misophonia!

Review Contents: I really like the comfort and sound quality is ok. I like the option of using a hardware backup if the battery runs out. It's lightweight enough to wear for many hours but it does lead to hot ears after a while.

I have yet to use this as a hands-free calling device.

So I decided to try out these headphones and I love them! Sound is great. Fits comfortable. Connects easily and clearly to my phone. Cost is obviously a huge plus! Love them.
Title: So I decided to try out these headphones and I love them! Sound is great

Review Contents: I purchased these headphones a month ago to replace a pair of in ear headphones that broke and so far I'm happy with them. For the price, they are better than I expected. Sound quality is very good for both music and talk. So far, they work well for phone calls. They are comfortable on your ears but they are a little heavy so while they are good for short periods, they feel cumbersome on your head after a long period. They last long before needing to be charged. It was a little harder to get these to pair with my phone than my previous headphones and if you hold the button on the right hand side to power them off for too long, they'll start attempting to pair again. All minor inconveniences, but at less than $40, I don't expect perfection. They feel durable and I do believe I will get more than a year out of them which is more than I got out of my previous pair. You can't go wrong for the price.
Title: Better than I expected for the price

Review Contents: Very, very well insulated. Like, way too well insulated. My ears get sweaty after like ten minutes, nevermind hours.Still, they're comfortable and the sound quality seems fine, especially for something as cheap as this. Can't complain much.

Review Contents: Clear sound. Easily connects via Bluetooth to my laptop. The battery lasts for at least several hours, like 8-10 on good volume. Nice beat. Volume control works well. Can charge while in use through the audio cord. Great gadget.

They are super comfy and are noise canceling, I have tried them myself and fell in love with them. He had a pair that the charge only lasted for 1 hour and we cannot use the headphone port on our iPad due to a faulty headphone cord from Five Below and the jack breaking off inside the port. He loves them for our iPad to play his games and to watch videos.

Review Contents: Very comfortable and easy to use Bluetooth headphones.  I'm very happy with this purchase.  I already have in-ear Bluetooth headphones but wanted over the ear set for a flight I'm taking.  These should work perfect!

Review Contents: Fantastic for the price. Comfortable for long flights (which is the only time I use them). I with their was a bit more for noise reduction, but decent sound quality.
Title: Fantastic for the price

Review Contents: My 12 year old son received these for his birthday and he loves them. Says they are comfortable, great sound quality and he loves the colour too. Highly recommended.

Review Contents: Totally worth it. Use them when I work at a desk, when I walk to and from the metro stop, and sometimes when I run on an elliptical. Good sound and great quality construction.
Title: Good sound and great quality construction

Review Contents: 11/9 update:Following the return of the second headphones and my review, Mpow sent a replacement and instructions for restoring to factor defaults. I have only had the replacement a couple weeks, but so far it is performing better for outdoor use than the two previous headphones. Indoor performance is decent, but not as good compared to the first set I bought. The headphones are more sensitive to interference from Wi-Fi and objects than I would prefer. For example, being near my laptop affects performance at times, causing momentary interruptions during page loads or downloads over Wi-Fi. In other situations not involving my laptop, performance may start fine but I hear more interruptions in playback over time. (I guess it could be interference from close neighbors networks or devices, but that's not something I would choose to spend much effort trying to avoid just for these headphones). Usually restoring solves the problems for a time. The improvement is enough that I have upgraded my rating from 2 to 3-3.5. I feel that if I had purchased this replacement I would feel comfortable keeping it, and it is nice to have responsive customer service.Original:I had to return two sets in the past couple months due to very poor bluetooth connection. The features and price seemed right for my purposes, so I wanted them to work. They looked fine, and the sound quality was okay. The cushions sat comfortably around my ears, not on ears, and there was no problem with my glasses. It was relatively easy to pair them to my phone and tablet, although I thought the controls were too hit or miss. I accidently powered off numerous times while pressing the button and trying to count the seconds and half seconds between options. I could leave my devices and walk around the house without dropping the connection. However, as soon as I got three or four steps from the house, with a device right on me, the connection turned horrible. Music would play for five seconds and cut out for two. The headphones would show up multiple times in the list of paired devices. I half suspected the headphones were trying to connect to other devices around the homes I passed by. Being a glutton for punishment and in disbelief about headphones that worked well indoors, I let this go on for 10 minutes or so. Then for no reason I could discern, they might play fine during the rest of my walk. I tried this a number of times, and the same thing happened every time. The wired connection is not an option for my phone and I really wanted something for outdoor use, so I could not keep the headphones. With the second set, they also worked great indoors. The connection problems outdoors were not as pronounced, though there were moments. What made me send those back was that the controls would stop responding at times - I could not repeat or advance tracks or stop playback at times. I never even got around to call handling with either set. I have to give these low marks for quality control.I just started wearing the Skullcandy Hesh2 headphones and don't have the problems with Bluetooth connection outdoors. I don't think the sound quality or comfort are any better than the Mpows for the money, but at least they work.
Title: Bluetooth problems...Updated

Review Contents: This headset has a rich lower tone more.  It's has lots of power, low distortion and the battery lasts for hours.  I charge it every other day and use to watch the boob tube when others are sleeping.  No complaints.

Title: Muffled sound

Review Contents: These are the BEST headphones I've EVER had (I've had tons)!! The cord is made so well that, so far, it has not broken. Title: Perfect

Review Contents: *** UPDATE ***After posting the original review, and spending a couple of weeks sending feedback to the seller a couple of times they sent a new pair of headphones were shipped to me at no cost. It took about 10 days to arrive but I will try them out for a week and see how it goes.  But for now I can raise it from a 1 star to a 3 star review purely based on the customer service. They responded relatively quickly to my emails sent through amazon and that shows a dedication that makes them worth trying. Hopefully it was just a bad pair and everything will work out now.Further update pending. It's always good to know the product quality as well and perhaps more importantly the customer service quality. That is half of what you pay for with anything. Especially the blind purchase process of online shopping.***  ORIGINAL REVIEW ***Don't waste your money on these. The biggest problem seems to be the internal components on these headphones. The sound quality is adequate but missing a bit of bass in my opinion. They worked for the first 2-3 weeks just fine in bluetooth mode. Then  all of a sudden the bluetooth has become unreliable.I've only used these about 10 - 20 times when working out at the gym. Even when fully charged the headphones now disconnect nowand then they won't stay connected. My phone says they are fully charged but they seem to be turning themselves off. I then have to plug in the headphones jack. Really disappointed because there is no option to return it now after the first month.  Don't risk it. For $30+ this is not acceptable quality.  Bluetooth technology has been around long enough and battery tech has gotten so good that this should not be a problem. I think the internal components on these are just not under very stringent quality controls. I got a reply from the seller but they only want me to troubleshoot the problem which is a hassle via email.The problem is the bluetooth on these just doesn't work after a while. For average sound quality these are a very risky choice if you are reliing on them as bluetooth headsets like I do when I use them for working out at the gym where extra wires are just annoying.On the plus side. They are comfortable, very good at isolating sound and reducing the noise around you. The buttons on the side are not laid out in the most easy way to blindly raise volume and skip tracks.  Without a little "braille" style bump on things you find yourself fishing around for the right button to answer calls or adjust volume and often times you hit the wrong one. I could overlook the negatives if they would just be reliable as a bluetooth headset. Also the mic seems to work well. When I did get phone calls there were no complaints on the other end about the sound quality and not being able to hear me. Maybe they'll make a 2nd generation and they'll address the problems. At that point these will be worth the gamble... maybe.*** UPDATE 10/17/17 ***So within 2-4 weeks the replacement pair's a bluetooth wireless functionality became unreliable as well. I keep it as a 3star rating because when I contacted the seller they were very helpful and allowed me to return them. So the customer service makes these worth a try!  It could be my phone but all of my other bluetooth accessories seem to work just fine. Maye I just got 2 bad pairs.
Title: UPDATED: Full review including a replacement pair. Testing for bluetooth reliability.

Review Contents: These arrived in a very timely manner. My husband needs earphones to hear TV. He LOVES these! He has been using IHIP earphones. Title: Great for occasional use

Review Contents: Probably my favorite headphones in a long time. I was skeptical in that I wasn't sure if I'd look like a tool at the gym with over-the-ear headphones. I was all over the little in-ear versions because I was adamant about sound and portability.  I'm over it.  These things look/feel like Beats headphones for a fraction of the cost.  In my opinion as you go above the $50-$80 range you get diminishing returns on sound quality.  Yes, these could sound better, but not enough that would push me into paying another $100.  They sound awesome (way better bass than ANY in-ear version, IMHO) stay on great, are sweatproof (so far) and the luxury of having the cord saves you from low battery moments or when exercise equipment is wired for sound.  TIP:  I put one of those Velcro wraps on the cord and have it attached to one side of the headphones (just in case I need it).

Title: Comfortable, Good Sound

Review Contents: Extraordinarily good value...but the headphones suffer from one glaring problem and one potential safety issue.I really like the sound on these--mostly clear and crisp. There's some muddiness in the bass--other reviews mention this--but given the price, I don't expect a pair of Bose. I hear a clear separation of the different tones and I really enjoy the sound.The fit is good, maybe a little tight on my head. The right earpiece presses a bit against my ear and I need to reposition 'em off from time to time. (I may end up finding just the right way to hang them on my head. TIme'll tell.)I'm not used to the controls, located on the right earpiece. I wish the device had a little bump or ridge or something so I place my finger properly on the volume controls. If I miss, I end up turning the phones off. The headphones are very responsive to Bluetooth connection and they pair and connect easily.Here's my problem: there are voice prompts that announce each action you take. "Power on." "Power off." "Your headphones are disconnected." Etc. Problem is that the voice is loud and that's jarring and unpleasant. I sent an email to the company's customer service department and asked the question on what passes for a support page. Let's see if they respond and if I have any control of the prompts. If not, it's a complete buzzkill and I'll likely return these otherwise excellent headphones.The smaller concern, one that could be a bit of a hazard, is that where the headband separates from the earpieces in order to adjust the size of the headband, the plastic has a fairly sharp edge. Grab the thing just so, or in a hurry, or carelessly, and I believe that one could pick up a nice slice. Which I don't recommend.Well, if these were perfect, I'd give 'em 5 stars. If customer service responds and I can fix it, then I'll add a star.  I'm expecting a response, but if I don't hear back, I'll deduct two more stars.Overall, I heartily recommend these, as long as I can turn off the voice prompts.PS: The red color is just too too much for me.
Title: Excellent sound but one possible fatal flaw

Firm fitting even when jogging and working out... Overall, just an amazing deal for stellar headphones.

Title: Whatta deal

Review Contents: "Impressive sound quality" as stated in the item description couldn't be farther from the truth. I have cheap ear buds that sound better than these headphones. Also, you know that deep bass you get with a high-quality stereo system? No? What about the bass you might get from an OK car stereo? Still no? One more try...you know the bass that little tiny speaker on your phone has? Yeah, that's the kind of bass you'll get with these headphones. None! The only reason I MIGHT not send these back is that they were only $34 and they might work well for listening to audio books while I clean my house. It would be disrespectful to any band you might listen to if you choose to listen to them on these headphones. Oh did I forget to mention the advertised 33-foot blue-tooth capability is not accurate? Try 20 feet. I'm not even going to try making a call to test the microphone because I would likely have to change the two-star rating to one and that just seems very negative.UPDATE:These are garbage and being returned. I'd rather put the $34 toward a higher quality product. You really do get what you pay for.

Title: Love it so much I ordered another

Review Contents: I've been using these only for about a week so these are just my initial impressions.Good:- The bluetooth synced with my Samsung s7 and my Windows 10 computer without any issues.- The headphones do a nice job of blocking out background noise. (They are not noise canceling, but the over ear design does a good job of blocking out sound.)- They seem solid and well made. The foam is nice and soft.- Can adjust volume using the buttons on the headphones rather than having to use the phone all the time.- You can plug them into your phone and keep listening even if you run out of battery for the bluetooth.- They fold up and fit in a nice little carry bag that it comes with for easy carrying.Not so good:- For me, these are not comfortable to use for more than about an hour or so. They squeeze your head and ears pretty tightly and after a while, it is too uncomfortable to wear. Despite the softness of the ear cups, my ears always start to hurt after wearing these for too long, so I still need to keep other headphones around to switch out. In all fairness, they do mention in the description that you should take them off every couple hours to give your ears time to rest. (For reference, I wear a size 7 3/8 inch fitted baseball hat. If you're a different size, they might be more comfortable for you.)- The sound is very bass heavy. Depending on the type of music you listen to, this may be a good thing. However, I listen to mostly audiobooks and podcasts and it does not sound great for this. The voices seem muffled and not sharp. This could likely be fixed by fiddling around with the EQ on my phone.- The sound quality is lower when streaming over bluetooth than when using the provided cable. I don't think this is a problem with the headphones themselves, just a fact of streaming the audio over bluetooth.Overall, for the price and considering the bluetooth works well, these are not too bad.
Title: Pretty good headphones for the price

Review Contents: For the price these things are amazing. They may not be for the hardcore audiophile, but for general video game playing, listening to music, youtube whatever, these do the job fantastically. Very comfortable on the ears and top of the head, and the build in microphone works well. Just got them 2 days ago and haven't even charged them yet, couple of hours of use per day.

If you don't care about audio quality, I'd say these are a solid buy, would probably work really well for podcasts/movies, and the convenience of the bluetooth at this price point is great. But, if you're unreasonably obsessed with audio quality, you'll have to do what I did and spring for a more expensive product like Bose, Beats, or something in that vein.

Review Contents: I have had a decade long struggle finding headphones that don‚Äôt irritate my outer cartilage piercings and earbuds that stay in my ears and don‚Äôt irritate my inner cartilage piercings. After resigning to the fact that over the ear headphones will never be compact and not bulky, I decided to try a pair. These jumped out at me for the price and shear number of reviews that gave positive marks. I skimmed through the reviews and didn‚Äôt see any glaring cons, so I decided to give these a go.For the money I really do like these:- They sound great.- They are easy to use.- They are soft and comfortable on the head.- They do actually block out a fair bit of noise.- BIGGEST PLUS: They don‚Äôt irritate my piercings whatsoever. They cover my entire ear, industrial bar and all.In my review skimming I did miss two cons that I noticed right away:- Yeah, they block out noise, but damn do these leak noise like crazy. I had my boyfriend wear them and listen to music on medium volume. It sounded like I was standing outside of a concert venue. I could hear the song softer than if I was wearing the headphones, but it was clear as day. We were both surprised at how much these leaked noise.- Oh my god, the flashing blue light that indicates that it‚Äôs on. In normal lighting it‚Äôs totally fine. In a dark room I can see it flashing in my peripheral vision and it drove me absolutely crazy. Not only can I see it, but it‚Äôs really bright and shines through both the LED ring and some of the seams of the plastic on the whole right side speaker. I ended up painting over the LED ring with black nail polish to try and dim the light so I could at least not see it flashing in my peripheral view. If anyone is wondering, this solution worked pretty well. Not 100%, but improvement enough where I‚Äôm not as bothered.I would give these three stars because the cons are quite big for me, but they are just so comfortable and do sound quite nice that I have to give them a little more credit.

Review Contents: This pair of headphones is a great product for the price. They have decent sound, and decent build quality. The Bluetooth connectivity works very well, as it will go very far without disconnecting. They do not have too much bass, though, but this is to be expected from a $35 pair of headphones. I was pleasantly surprised at the build quality, and the color looks amazing. It has a very long battery life, and does not take too long to charge. Another upside is that they have a standard micro-usb port to charge them. My only other complaint is that the microphone is absolutely horrible, and it does not catch the sound very well. Even in a silent room, I have had people tell me on the phone that I sound like I am far away from the microphone. Even so, it still works OK. Overall, these headphones are a great value for the price, and I was pleasantly surprised when I got them.

Title: Big disappointment

Review Contents: I trust the MPOW name. I have owned several pair of MPOW v4.1 fitness headphones because they go over the eat and in the ear. After heavy gym, running and motorcycle use on the gulf coast of MS and being military, when MPOW came out with big noise cancelling headphones, I was pretty sold.1st they look great, I bought in all black.2. Super comfortable. The soft leather around the ears never get gross and I forget they're on.3. Easy to pair, takes 2 seconds unless you use the Aux jack.4. Sound amazing. Loud, deep bass, real clear and cancel noise real well. I use them all the time on flights.5. Last forever. After 5 days of constant use and blasting music, FaceTime calls and movies, they finally died but charged up while I left them plugged in while I went to work.I was on the fence about headphones like these when the whole big heaphone craze struck a few years ago and couldn't talk myself into a pair. Once I found out my favorite Bluetooth headphone company came out with a pair, sold!I will buy another pair when these buy the farm. I love them. I'll be getting my wife a pair for Christmas.

Title: Good headphones for the price

Review Contents: I have used these headphones for 10 days and can say that for under $40.00 dollars these are some very good full size Bluetooth headphones.The Good:No distortion on max volume - it‚Äôs definitely loud unless you‚Äôre very hard of hearing.  I can go into another room and it does not start losing connection until you get between 20 to 30 feet, so that is good.  Hi tones, mid ranges and low base are pretty good in my opinion.  Construction is very sturdy but if you don't treat it right you will break it.  Comfort is not bad and should fit just about anybody with a normal range size head and ears but if you do have very large ears it will be a tossup so then you will just have to try it out and if it doesn't work out send it back for a refund.  The battery life seem very good but I have not tested it till its drained completely - I charged it fully when I received it and have charged it once in the ten days that I have used it with about 2 hours a day usage.  I will not be using it for outside work since I personally think that it really is not designed for that but traveling, around the house, at the office and casual listing it would be ideal.  The headphones look really good to me but if you don't like the color red then you‚Äôre out of luck but I like it so no problem.  I have also used this headphone paired with my phone and it has a very good mic, the people I talked to said I was very clear and they were clear to me as well so that was a plus.  I have not tried it out for wired hook up but should have, then again my main purpose was Bluetooth only - I already have a nice wired headset.The Bad:Well there is not much really at this point (10 days) but for longevity - if it last then it will be a very good headphones and if it does stop working hopefully the warranty will be honored but at $40.00 dollars it might just be cheaper to buy a new one.  If I have anything to grip about would be that it is not totally silent on the outside after the volume is up half way, now don't get me wrong it's not really load but you can start to hear what is playing on the headphones if you are sitting close to the person wearing the headphones or if it is really quite where you‚Äôre at then people will slightly hear your music especially if you have the volume cranked up.  This does not really bother me but it might bother some people.I am really happy that I purchased these Bluetooth headphones and would recommend them for purchase.Will update if things change.
Title: Mpow Bluetooth Headphones Over Ear

I don‚Äôt recommend that anyone waste money on this product regardless of how good the seller‚Äôs customer service is. Title: Very nice set of headphones

Review Contents: Ok, I like these bluetooth headphones for the price. I had no issues connecting them to the MPOW 2 in 1 receiver/transmitter so I could listen to my TV show and not disturb my husband. I did not get lag between picture and sound. They work for what I bought them for. Because they are not noise cancelling, I can hear the phone ring, or my husband calling for me. I have only one complaint, if you are binge watching TV and your ears are a bit larger than the 0.5 deep, 1.5 inch wide and 2.25 tall opening, you will experience some discomfort after an hour. My ears start out rubbing on the stitching. After an hour the cushioning was going flat (it does bounce back) and my ears started feeling the hard plastic edge the speakers are mounted to. To be fair I have a set of wireless Logitech G930's that I use for my computer for gaming, VOIP, and for music. At 1/3 of the price, I was not expecting anything to compare to those headphones for comfort and sound. But my Gaming headphones are not bluetooth and that is what I needed.

Review Contents: These are decent headphones.  The build quality is quite nice.  Pairing wasn't too bad.  These ARE NOT noise cancelling, the title said they were but in the detailed description they stated that they are NOISE ISOLATING.  VERY different!  If the title didn't incorrectly state this, I would have given these 4 stars.  The headphones are comfortable and sturdy though.  I am not displeased with them but I am disappointed that they are not noise cancelling as they stated.  They have good audio range.  Highs and lows all sound good, nice and crisp.  Range was about 50' with my MSFT Surface.  Sometimes the play/pause button acts stupid with Spotify.  Not sure if it is the headphones or the laptop?  All in all, pretty good headphones but nothing spectacular.

Review Contents: I'm very very very very surprised by the price and quality of this unit.  As a professional DJ for over 20 years I know a thing or two about headphones.  This purchase was not so much to plug to my mixer and play at a live gig but more for a my tv to watch at night without bothering my wife.  Let me start first with sound.  Not the best quality sound out there but for the price it's above average.  But, the best part about this unit is the quality and durability.  Most cheap headphones will have plastic extenders.  You slides those up and down few time and crack time to get a new one.  With that said I was impressed to see metal extenders and overall durability of the item.  I used this last night to pair to my Panasonic tv via bluetooth to watch a move and ya I love it.  I wouldn't have thought this would be anywhere near to the level it is.  I  highly recommended.

Returned mine and would not recommendFollow up (05/25/17):  Patozon (MPOW) contacted me directly after I posted this review to appoligize for my bad experience with their headphones and wanted to make things better.  They offered me a different set of head phones (Mpow Muze Wireless) and asked if I would please give them a try.  I was very surprised by this great of customer service and decided that I would give them a try.  if you are looking for a better set of headphones you should try those instead (link below).  Overall these headphones weren't great but MPOW has great Customer Service and they have made things right by offering a different set of headphones that are more in line with what I was looking for.https://www.amazon.com/Mpow-Wireless-Bluetooth-Stereo-Headphones/dp/B00O7Q4IBU

Title: SO SO

Review Contents: REVISED REVIEWI initially posed the below review and gave the product two starts. However, after the seller reached out and I tweaked a few things with my use of the product, an updated review was warranted. Kudos to the seller for being responsive and addressing the issues I had quickly.After using the headphones a bit more, they are not bad for $37. The sound quality isn't what you might get in the $100+ range, but that is to be expected. I initially had some issues with the Bluetooth connection, but it appears to have been partially an issue on my end. I tried a new device and the connection is better, although still not perfect (occasional skip in the connection still noticeable).Same verdict for the unbalanced sound. This has been improved with using a different phone. However, there does still seem to be a slight difference in the sound coming from the right ear versus the left. This may be me being overly picky, but it does seem noticeable to me when using them.With these improvements, I would say they are not bad for the price. I'm still not sure they fit my needs. They are a bit larger than I anticipated (not the seller's fault by any means, just larger than I prefer for my intended use). I also realized I am looking for a bit better sound quality overall. Again, not something that is really the fault of the seller -- these are $37 Bluetooth headphones. But after listening to the nice pair of wired headphones I have again, I'm not sure these meet my expectations for their intended use.ORIGINAL REVIEWAfter using these a few times since they arrived I'm not a fan. The Bluetooth connection cuts in and out in a fairly regular basis. The right speaker is also noticeably louder than the left. Not sure if I received a defective unit or not. Maybe that's just what happens with $37 headphones I guess. Will likely be returning these.

Title: Five Stars

Review Contents: I'm not an audiophile who understands every nuance and detail of a speaker, so my perspective is one of a layman.  I bought these solely for mowing and trimming my acre-and-a-half yard (takes about 2 to 2.5 hours total).  These remain comfortable that entire time, and the battery will last for several mows.  The materials certainly don't feel like the most indestructible, I am content for the price.  Sweat doesn't seem to be an issue with these as the padding does a good job keeping it out of the ear/speaker.The only thing keeping me from giving them five stars is the lack of an actual on/off switch.  Turning it off is simply holding the play button down for a few moments and then releasing.  Unfortunately, this is also the way to pair a device.  I find that I turn them off on the first try about half of the time, with the other times waiting several moments for it to give up trying to pair.  It's annoying for me, but it may not be a concern for others.  Nonetheless, I'd buy these again without hesitation.

Review Contents: New update:  the company has sent me a new set of headphones and this set is working very well.  The first set definitely had some sort of problem.  The only problem is that the headphones do hurt after wearing for awhile but it's still a very good value.  The headphones pair up very well with my bluetooth devices, everything is in sync, and the sound quality is phenomenal for this price point.  Very satisfied customer!Updated Review:  The customer service team has reached out to me and is sending me another set with no hassles.  This type of customer service is very rare these days.  Perhaps I received a defective unit.  Once I receive the new set of headphones, I will update my review.My main reason for purchasing these headphones was for the bluetooth function.  Well the bluetooth is worthless.  I've paired with two laptops and a mobile phone.  Each connection has been extremely choppy to the point where it's too annoying to even think about connecting with bluetooth.  Also the audio is delayed and is not in sync with the video.  The sound quality is about what you expect for $35 headphones.  I'm extremely disappointed.  If you plan on using this for the bluetooth, just know that I warned you.  I rarely write reviews but I wanted everyone to be warned so you don't make the same mistake I made.

Title: Yes. Buy this.

Review Contents: It's taken me this long to write a review because I was skeptical as to how in love with these headphones I was.They are short of perfect. Fit snug, which really enhances the great bass that these headphones have, and the battery charge lasts about 18 hours. I estimate this using the headphones daily including a gym session. Takes me 9 days on average before I need to charge them.Cons: Not much. The included aux cord could have a mic and control on it and if you want to wear a hood with these headphones it makes a large ring like something out of Star Wars. I tried the MPOW H4 thinking maybe they would be better... NOPE. Did not fit as snug and therefore had far less volume and bass.This is not just a bargain but an investment. I genuinely enjoy using these headphones every day. In the office, at the gym, at home reading... The best headphones I've ever owned!

Review Contents: I purchased these in May mainly to listen to music and TV without disturbing my spouse.  After 2 recharges they would no longer charge.i tried them again intermittently with no luck. The headphones were at that point past the warranty end date (I was traveling a lot and hadn't the desire to work on that particular problem just then). After posting a negative review I was contacted by the manufacturer who had already put a new pair of headphones in the mail to me.  I received them shortly after and have not had any problems charging this pair.  I have a larger head for a woman, and I find these comfortable even while wearing glasses.  I am happy with the sound quality while listening to music files of a higher bit rate as well as video sound.  Head phones cannot up the quality of thin audio so keep that in mind when critiquing. Cost does not equal sound quality in head phones.

Review Contents: Summary:The Good:-----------------+Long battery life+Look great!+Comfortable+Can be used as wired headphones+Fairly durable build+Easy to setup and use--------------------The Bad:----------------------Sound quality is not great. (yet not terrible)*Edit: pretty much 'louder music' like rock or metal, sounds TERRIBLE on these! my $20 bt headphones blow this out of the water.-Micro USB port feels a little flimsy-Charging while in wired mode makes a loud 'hissing'-Built in mic is worthless.-Foam ear pads cant be removed for cleaning.I really like the fact that these can be used wireless to save battery,The fact that if you use them (wired) while charging, produces a fairly noticeable hiss, is kinda annoying.But by far the most disappointment thing I found so far is the sound quality.It's by no means terrible, but I'd had $20 BT headphones that were half the size, and sounded twice as good.The overall sound is fairly flat. highs are a bit distorted, mids are okay, but lows sound fairly poor.This is my 4th pair of <$40 BT headphones, and the sound is probably the second worst.But again, they don't sound terrible. I'd consider it 'acceptable'.(Using your phones 'equalizer' can help a lot.  I was able to get much better  sound quality with a few seconds of tweaking.. But I'm reviewing these headphones on the default settings)Basically if you're not picky (AT ALL) about how your music sounds, or want to listen to audio books, these would be fine.And besides, they are very comfortable and convenient.As for the microphone, as the others said, it's almost completely unusable, you'd be much better off using speaker phone.It's fairly clear, but it EXTREMELY quiet, talking at normal volume sounds like whispers.---------Edit:-------------- I gave these a chance, and they are much worse than I though,I considered returning them and seeing if I just got a bad pair, but I've seen quite a few other reviews also mention issues with sound quality.I decided to listen to some other music styles, Louder music like classic rock, metal, and even some more modern rock sounds like TRASH on these headphones.I'm talking worse than some $20 bt heaphones I bought years ago, heck, even my $10 sony wired headphones sound MUCH better.Pop music sounds okay, and pretty much many other styles/songs that are mainly in the mid range. (still worse than most other $30 bt heaphones)But these were a huge disappointment.I'll be sending them back for a full refund monday.  I'm not playing the exchange lottery.

Review Contents: As with any headphones at entry pricing, one doesn't expect too much. But I decided on this pair because of the look and the price, and I will not hesitate to proclaim that it blew my expectations through the roof.The headphones feel very sturdy and look just like a pair of $300+ headphones. They feel comfortable on my ears, and only start to get uncomfortable on my ears after about four or so hours of use.The sound is very crisp, and it's a lovely experience. The bass is really good, and the highs and mods blend easily. As for volume, the phone can be at maximum volume, and you can still go louder if need be.The connecting experience is excellent. The last pair of headphones I bought required you to manually connect on your phone each time. These automatically connect after the first initial connection so long as you have bluetooth turned on on your phone. And it's so smooth and simple.As for any other attributes, the battery life is very good compared to a quick charge time, the amount of outside noise that it cancels out is very good (super loud noises will still get through), and all in all it's just a great headset and worth the buy.I'll be sure to update the review as I continue to use it as I've only had it for a few weeks now. If you do decide to buy, I hope you enjoy it as much as I have!

Review Contents: I bought these for three reasons:  1) price; 2) noise cancellation;  and 3) Bluetooth.  The product delivers on all three, but getting Bluetooth to work was difficult because the first set of headphones I was sent was defective (I think the problem was that it would not take a charge). With replacement headphones, I have since been able to get Bluetooth to work consistently, on several devices.  I did not give the product 5 stars because it lacks an indication of its level of charge. Also, the most aggravating aspect of the product is that there is no easy way to contact Tech Support.  Having said this, Mpow's Tech Support does read Amazon reviews and if there is a problem you will hear from them straight away.  Tech Support sent me a second pair of headphones which work beautifully,

Review Contents: After dealing with a $150+ pair of headphones lasting 11.5 months and then their replacement lasting three and running out the warranty, I decided to fully embrace the era of disposable hardware and get the Mpow M3.Sound is better than I expected, though possibly too bassy for some kinds of music. I'm still not a huge fan of the style‚Äîespecially the glossy plastic on the outside‚Äîbut that's not a killer either. Bluetooth has been really good, supporting multipoint with my iPhone 6s Plus and my MacBook Pro with no issues. The controls are a bit awkward (particularly how the volume on the right cup doesn't control the phone volume, but a secondary range of headphone volume), but usable.All-in-all, though, for thirty-five bucks, and carrying an 18-month warranty? These feel like a steal. We'll see how long they last, but even if I had to buy a pair every year, I think I'd be happy.UPDATE: That secondary volume? Actually comes in really handy with my Samsung TV, which has no volume adjustment when in Bluetooth mode.

Review Contents: My favorite headphones yet, and affordable! (I've had a few through the years). Mostly I use them with the¬†JETech 2-in-1 Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Audio Receiver and Transmitter with 3.5mm Jack¬†to watch TV/listen to music from TV.Here are the steps I take:1. Turn TV on.2. Hold down on/off until I hear "Power On."3. Hold down on/off button on the little JETech receiver/transmitter until flashing red light turns to solid blue.4. Plug JETech receiver/transmitter into headphone jack on my TV Roku remote. Wait a few seconds. Done! Start watching and listening! Yay!NOTE: The above steps are AFTER the first and only time you set up the pairing between the devices. Once paired, you never have to re-set again. Headphones and JETech "remembers" each device from then on.These headphones give me reception anywhere in my 750+ square-ft apartment and still hear anything I'm playing! The only "con" I can think of is that there is about a 2% "feedback" or "buzzing" only when the audio on the program playing pauses, such as when people stop speaking in the show. But, this is so negligible, that I debated whether to even mention it in this review, thus the product still deserves my five stars, in my opinion.I use these many hours a day, and they hold at least a 10 hour charge-amazing! I do plug in to re-charge every evening of use.I just can't really say enough good things about this product. You will not be disappointed if you purchase these!

Review Contents: Okay, as a real technoklutz, I still managed to get these things to function.  Well, sometimes.  I seem to have to go through a lot of powering up each time I try to use them.  There is far more rigamarole than I am will to put up with given my number one complaint:These things are just not big enough.  They press down on the top of my head.  press, press, down, down, down.  My head is not outstandingly large, at least by hat size, but there seems to be no way to keep these things from pressing, pressing, pressing.  And I've never had this problem before with other earphones even cheap one on airlines or my old SONY long wire.Whatta waste and after all the nuisance setting up and slow discovery of the pressing, pressing, problem, I'm stuck.  Lesson learned:  if it has to fit in any way, buy it from a store.

Review Contents: this is my first forray into listening to music on my phone...it's just something i never do...nor have EVER done...the apple earbuds do NOT fit my ears (or e[se i just don't know how to use them)...i thought i'd try the headphone approach and decided to go bluetooth to eliminate what looked to be a messy arrangement with the hardwired phones...i knew NOTHING about brands--well, except that BOSE was the way to go if you could afford it, which i couldn't...i looked for something in the 30$ range and settled on this set which had thousands of reviews with a very high rating...that many people could not POSSIBLY be wrong....they showed up in a couple of days so i dug into the box...i charged them up for a while and, in the meantime,, opened the instruction book...the book is just a little bigger than a large postage stamp and written in 6 languages...of course, the english version reads like it was written by a korean that was not only FOB, but was still ON the boat...long story short, once i saw the direction we were headed, i got the phone/phones to sync up and we were off to the races...it comes with a charging cable and a cable for a hard connection from a computer to the phones...the phones fold up easily for storing in the VERY nice carry-bag included...they are NOT BOSE, but the sound is very good and i doubt that you could do better at this price point...

Folding feature is nice but storage is complicated and it doesn't slip right into the bag like one would hope. Comfort is like 6/10 becausese the area around my ears start to hurt after a while. Overall a bit clunky and not worth 30+. I'm disappointed since this was so highly rated, just glad only use it with my laptop‚Äã while working and not actually trying to enjoy music.

Title: Four Stars

Review Contents: Update:  at the fourth time of using these headphones, they crapped out entirely.  Would not pair, although they had been paired and were working fine. All they would do is rapidly flash lights, and the operation was wildly inconsistent- at times I couldn't even make them power off.These are comfortable, the sound is very good, and there was no problem pairing them- I bought these and am using them exclusively to watch tv, and the sound quality and clarity is very good; I am amazed and at how much I never heard in terms of background sounds, and I now hear dialogue that I totally missed before.  However, there is one feature that is truly annoying, and this probably only matters if these are used to watch tv in a dark room: every two seconds a bright blue light flashes on the control side of the headset, and I can see it in my peripheral vision.  And by bright, I mean it took 6 layers of blue paper painters tape to cover the light so I couldn't see it.  I think these are a great value for the price, if you don't mind having to tape over the bright blue light (if that's even an issue); but for this one drawback, these headphones would get five stars from me.
Title: Update:  total failure.  Don't buy this.  If you plan to use these for tv, read this first

Review Contents: When I initially received my order, I noticed the ear space seemed smaller than what was pictured on the site and thought perhaps I was sent the wrong item. I do think the photo is kind of misleading because, in person, the ear space doesn‚Äôt look that large. They did end up fitting over my ears but quite snuggly. Luckily, I have small ears but for anyone who has larger ears or a bigger head, these might be uncomfortable. The headphones are quite tight around my head and start to hurt after a while wearing them. I can‚Äôt wear them with earrings or my glasses because they literally only have JUST enough space for your ears.They are convenient and pair quickly with a Mac. If you step out of range of the bluetooth, whatever is playing on your device will disconnect and play out loud so beware of that.The play/pause and volume controls are a little hard to differentiate immediately because they are so close together and feel the same. I wish there was a bump or something so I can know which button I‚Äôm pressing. More color options would be nice but I do the like red.Overall, they are a pretty good product for the price but the tightness/ear space is too small and uncomfortable.Mpow Bluetooth Headphones Over Ear, Hi-Fi Stereo Wireless Headset, Foldable, Soft Memory-Protein Earmuffs, w/ Built-in Mic and Wired Mode for PC/ Cell Phones/ TV

Review Contents: I was looking for an affordable alternative to the earbuds that came with my new iPod (as with every Apple earbud they sounded good but kept falling out with every move...forget being active when wearing them)...being a "thrifty" guy (some say cheap...I prefer "thrifty") I read the reviews on this headset and decided that for the price I would order a set. They work and sound good. They were super easy to set up for my iPod. They are comfortable enough (when wearing glasses I have had to adjust them from time to time...I fault the the thin eyeglass temple more than the headset for this). I wear a size 7 3/4 hat (mule head üòù) and these fit with no problem. About 30' is the range before you loose the signal for Bluetooth. I have used them for maybe 6 hours (on and off) and they still have sufficient charge...they also seem to recharge quickly using the ubiquitous Android cable. The controls on the right earpiece work well...skipping songs and such. Hey...in a nutshell, they work good, sound good and they didn't cost $200-$300 (which is important to a "thrifty" guy üòùüòùüòù)...what more could you ask?
Title: Great headset for the "thrifty" guy üòÑ

Review Contents: So far I have no complaints other than the fact that they were a little larger than my previous set of bluetooth headphones. I had two pairs of Jam headphones that were smaller and more lightweight, and had great sound, but they had problems with reliability. After one year or so of using the Jam headphones, one pair had a wire that was intermittent and I could only hear sound out of the right side, On the other pair, the charging port basically went bad, so I couldn't charge them anymore, so it was time to switch brands.These Mpow bluetooth headphones are very comfortable and cover my ears completely. They also seem to be better quality as far as construction, but the sound quality is not as good as the Jams...but good enough for my use. These Mpow headphones are not noise cancelling headphones, but I did not want noise cancelling headphones, because I want to be able to hear someone if they are trying to get my attention. They do shut out quite a bit of outside sound though, compared to the Jam headphones. So I guess it's a matter of preference. I just hope these Mpows hold up longer than the Jam headphones did. For the price though, I guess if these go bad, it wouldn't break my bank account to get another pair. So far, I am very pleased!

Review Contents: Really solid headphones. The sound quality for calls is excellent, the mic is very good. Sound quality for music is also very good with strong bass. I just tried out some random odd stuff to see how it sounded (Zefside rap, Brass House, Emo Alternative, Some Liquid DnB, 70's prog rock, Parody Metal, and Japanese hard rock. Ya know, the usual) and everything sounded fantastic.Oddly the best feature for me has been the coverage. Since they are full ear covering, they've kept my ears toasty warm during the latest surge of the polar vortex.They hold a charge for an obscenely long time, not that I'm complaining.These were a great purchase and I'm very pleased with them so far.

Review Contents: These are over the ear headphones, not on the ear. My ears are normal in size and the cups are comfortable. If using these for casual music listening and or podcasts they deliver. Speech is quite acceptable with no noticeable coloration. If you are expecting great musical performance with a clear window into the delicacies, look elsewhere and get out you wallet.Musically they do nothing to ruin the music, it's more of an omission. Basically non-involving but acceptable.Answering calls has not been an issue and no one has mentioned anything pertaining to the sound.Comfort depends on the users head shape and width.The earpieces being full coverage will retain heat, so if you're a heavy sweater that may be an issue with any over the ear headphone.Battery life is above average which is a bonus.Build quality seems above average especially for the price point.3 stars because there are no headphones worthy of 5 stars anywhere close this price point.For the money and if they fit your intended use, I recommend them highly.

Review Contents: I've had these headphones for about three weeks now and I love them! Today was my first time to take them outside of the house (I mostly use them for laying on the couch and listening to music) and they worked just fine on the 20 minute walk to work. My ears did get a bit sweaty but that's any over the ear headphones I've ever used. I especially like that the ear cups(?) are soft and squishy, without the price tag that usually accompany that feature. No problems pairing once I read the instructions, I love that they fold up, and the little bag is nice but I honestly never use it. A great set of headphones if you're a normal headphone user looking for something wireless!

Review Contents: **Do not buy**You've heard of adamantium, the indestructible metal that coats Wolverine's bones. Now let me introduce you to Chinesium, the worthless crap that seems to be the primary building material for everything that comes from China.These headphones are made out of 100% pure Chinesium. I've had these for less than a year and the Bluetooth is already failing. It is constantly cutting out. I'm less than 4 feet from my laptop and the connection cuts out every 30 seconds or so. It is incredibly irritating.The actual headphones themselves are designed for the world's tiniest of ear. So get ready for having your ears smashed and the discomfort that is sure to follow.Additional note: The instructions are a very bad and hilarious translation!
Title: Total garbage. DO NOT BUY

Review Contents: UPDATE 10/19: I noticed a small crack running across the headband a few weeks ago.  They still fit & seem to be holding up physically... However, they no longer charge.  I plug them in, the amber charging light comes on, but they just get hot.  They won't turn on anymore.  They were quite cheap, so I'm not terribly disappointed.  I had hoped to get at least 6 months of use out of them, though.The battery does indeed last for friggin ever, as others have noted. I definitely have to charge my phone more than my headphones.The sound quality is pretty much fine. You won't be blown away, but neither will you miss out your favorite parts of your favorite songs. It's a little lighter on the bass than I would prefer, but all told the sound is quite alright.Durability seems fine. I've never been particularly gentle with my things...I'm just clumsy. The hinges show no signs of wear, two months into daily use, and the fit is still the same. (They are on the snug/average size for bighead me. Larger heads might not be comfortable.)The headphones do indeed have a microphone, but it's not as sensitive as needed. I sometimes have to cup my hand between my mouth & the side of the headphones with the mic hole. It's not the end of the world, however. I only use them for calls occasionally.I take off one star because of the mic, and became I haven't yet been able to get them into "listening" mode, so that I can give voice commands. (My other BT headset, for example, you just hold the Play button for a moment.All in all still a fantastic bargain.

Review Contents: So I had been looking for a solid pair of noise-cancelling, bluetooth headphones for a while. I never really found anything I loved until I sort of bought these Mpow 059's on a whim, I needed something for the office asap. When I got them I was really impressed with the build. They are a very nicely weighted pair of headphones with super comfy memory foam. They also look amazing for $37, I got the red and they look great. The paired up quickly with my MacBook and I tested them out listening to everything to from rap, EDM, techno/house, country, and folk.Unfortunately, the sound quality is kinda poor. I have better sound from my $15 Sony ear buds. The music sounds distant, almost like being played in another room or "underwater". And this is listening to many generas of music, not just one. I am not sure I will keep them, as I really expected better sound, even at $37. Three stars for them looking and feeling amazing on my head though.

Review Contents: I was originally excited at the idea of some earmuff headphones. Overall, the quality on these are solid for the short period of time that I've used them. The sound quality is good. The fit was solid. Mainly, I just didn't like the feel over time. They made my ears sweat, so long term use was out of the question.The only real knock I had on them is that they weren't usable with my macbook for conference calls. The mic just wasn't loud enough to work with the meetings I had. For music, they're great over short times. I'm sure others will be quite pleased with them. I have several Mpow products and this is a good one, just not for me.edit: Patozon reached out afterward and sent me an updated model (H2) that does have an improved phone mic. I bumped it to 4 stars because of this. The style is still not for me, but that's my taste, not a reflection of the quality of the product. Definitely appreciated their willingness to make it right.
Title: Style not for me. Phone mic not great.

Review Contents: These look good, and with the cord in they are amazing. But I bought them for the bluetooth features, and for that these are hot garbage. It skips and cuts out when the phone is at my feet. I used these in the gym and they are fully charged, and music wasn't loud at all and they cut out more than it played. I have had some expensive brands and never had this problem, not until they were close to being done forever. Out the box i got skips and cut outs. I went to them gym and got so mad bc these won't do the job. I was close to getting the MPOW smaller ones, the ones that look like the powerbeats- but now im so mad in writing this review before I got my post workout shower. Dont get these, spend the extra $ for the real deal. I did some good research before buying and these were top rated by Amazon, for what reason I dont know. I just had my beats go out on me after many years and wanted to try a cheaper alternative. Well I paid the cost here, now I got to dig in my dumpster for the box to mail these back. I will not recommend this brand nor endorse them at all.3/7/18 UPDATE : I did get a updated replacement pair from the vendor. The quality is way better, and the bluetooth cutting out isnt an issue with this pair either. I do like them, they are more sleek. I do not know the model # of the new pair. The customer service was amazing, reaching out to me setting up a replacement pair. Great service.

Title: Four Stars

Review Contents: I've had this for just over a week after losing a pair of bluetooth Sony on-ear headphones and having my in-ear earbuds fail on me. It looked great when I first opened the box. Construction feels solid (although I do worry about the durability of the hinge - where the cups bend, since that area does feel shaky). Connection to both my phone and laptop was easy and this device is truly multipoint. The sound quality was decent. Better than you would expect at this price point, but not quite up there with the best. But I'm a college student who's simply looking for some music while he's studying. In terms of comfort, this was solid. It's heavier than some of the headsets I've had in the past, but not by much. The padding on the cups and the top definitely feels nice. The only problem was that if I sweat, it accumulates around my ears, which can feel irritating, but that's not specific to this headphone. The battery life is also excellent. I use these often throughout the day with at around 8 hours being through the bluetooth feature and the battery has yet to run out. One thing to note, however, is that using a cord with these will disable the microphone feature, which can be an issue if you use that often, but it was not a big deal for me.So why only 3 stars? Well, although the headset is able to connect perfectly with my devices, it struggles to maintain a clear connection. More specifically, for example, there are many times when I put my phone into my jean pocket and the music would constantly cut off. It happens enough that it becomes frustrating. I would connect the headphone to my phone with ease and start playing music with no problems, but then I put my phone in my pocket, and it starts cutting off the music for 1-2 second periods. This doesn't happen on most of my past bluetooth headsets and the one it did wasn't nearly as bad. It's really the only glaring flaw of this headset. I think bluetooth headphones should be able  to maintain clear connections through a layer of clothing such as jeans. Maybe I have a defective one? I don't know.So in all, I would say these are a very decent pair of headphones from sound to battery, but there's something off about their connectivity. Would I recommend this? Probably, since I'm assuming mine might be defective. If you tend to hold your phone, use it only as wired headphones (wire provided),  or have it in such a way that there are absolutely 0 barriers between it and your device, then these are as good a bluetooth headphone as you will get for the price, but otherwise, it might be a good idea to check out some other alternatives.

I couldn't judge for myself.2 - While the headset holds well on my head for now as I said it has only been a few days, I have quite a wide head, and typically these headsets tend to relax with age - it should be perfect for living room listening but I'd like to do sports with these as I have with my previous ones and I can't guarantee they will hold well.Still, so far no problem, happy customer.

Review Contents: I just got these last week and i must say these look like really nice headphones. I got the red and black and right away i took notice to the glossy exterior which is beautiful. I also like the soft case it comes with to store my headphones and the wires to charge and use for non bluetooth connection. I do wish it came with a adapter to plug the wire to charge the headset with but luckily i have my samsung adapter so it ok for me. I charged them and i took about about 2-3 hours for the first full charge. I then tried to pair them to my samsung galaxy s7 and they paired with no issues. The fit pretty well for me but yes if you do have a big head it would think it would be a little snug and tight. Im actually listening to music as i right this review and i must say the sound is pretty awesome. Ive also used them at work and they do have some noise cancellation in them because i could barely hear a thing with these headphones on and i didnt have them loud at all. Now its been about a week and im sure the charge on these has lasted at least 10+ hours nonstop but overall so far these are worth the price and i wasnt expecting such great quality for $30 headphones. Money well spent :)

Title: Five Stars

Review Contents: love it! as someone who has never owned bluetooth headphones or earbuds, i've always found the cable quite irritating when i want to remove myself from my devices and get up and do something else, but still listen to music.  i can walk downstairs to my kitchen and grab a snack from the fridge and walk back upstairs without having the audio interrupted at all, which is amazing. I did hear the audio speed up slightly one time, but i turned it off and on and everything was fine. the pairing is just almost instantaneous and it's so easy to use + has such a long battery life! i feel like i can go a week without charging it, i charge it every night but that seems to be too much even if i use it for like 3 hours of listening to music. i also forgot to turn it off a few times when i fell asleep and woke up and the battery percentage on my phone still read near full battery. only complaint is that wearing earrings/piercings will hurt if you wear these over your ears, so take them off first, but that's obvious. i haven't taken these to the gym yet, but they're quite secure on my ears and probably would not fall off (although, since they are over-ear, they are quite large and bulky and would probably not be advised to bring while you're bouncing up and down on a treadmill). of course, these are not active noise-canceling, so they cannot drown out all the sound around you, but it still works great. after a while, your ears do hurt, but the seller even sent me an email reminding me how the headphones worked and to take them off after an hour or two to give your ears a break. i'd suggest buying earbuds along with this if you're not into that/want a lighter load when walking around outside your home.
Title: in love! really great if you've been annoyed by cables all your life and frequently fall asleep without turning off your devices

Review Contents: I wish I'd been able to buy these sooner, but my old tower system didn't have Bluetooth on the motherboard.  The new system does, and not having to fool with the too-long cord on my former headset, nor risk having that cord get caught up in my chair casters is more than worth the price of these headphones--which, all things considered, is extremely reasonable.  They work exactly as I expected, are comfortable enough to wear for an hour or so before I need to free my ears up, and the sound quality is more than adequate for gaming and watching movies and TV on Prime or what-have-you.I know that one day the batteries won't take a charge and I'll have to replace them.  I'll just come back to see what the company is offering then. I can't find any downsides to this purchase so far, which is a rare thing these days.
Title: Expectations met or exceeded--no buyer's remorse on these headphones!

Review Contents: I was looking for an entry level bluetooth headphone for studying and going to the gym. I was using the sony MDR-7506 but was afraid that it would sooner or later break due to it being in my backpack and from all the books and stuff that goes in it. On top of that the SONY MR-7506 is not portable! It's absolutely huge!These MPOW Bluetooth headphones were perfect for me, for $40 you get comfortability, Bluetooth, and durable quality. I was impressed about the audio sound, didn't expect to much for such a cheap price! if you're trying to compare them to beats, it doesn't have as much base as the wireless beats, but it is on par when the aux cord is used. These are perfect for small ears, snugs right around em. I was also looking at another product from MPOW called MUZE, it's on their website but decided to go with these because of the price!No regrets, it's working fine and had no problems yet!  **Had them since 03/15/17MPOW HOOK ME UP WITH THE MPOW MUZE I would love to try them!

Review Contents: I received these headphone on 10/9/17 and today is 10/12/17 so I haven‚Äôt had them long to do a full review, but based on the reviews I read before my purchase they are worth all 5 stars. I charged them on the first day for a couple hours just to make sure the battery was full and I‚Äôve used them everyday since without having to recharge. The sound is great so far. I can turn the volume all the way up on my phone then turn the volume up some more with the volume on the headphones. Pairing was really easy and it takes hardly any time to connect to my phone upon powering up. They are very comfortable and light weight, but people with bigger ears may not feel the same about the comfort; my ears are small/medium. I found that talking on the phone was seamless, I had no trouble hearing or with connectivity. I‚Äôm not sure what people are looking for when the topic of noise cancelling comes up, but I wore mine while cutting grass and I could hear the music just fine. If I just had to make a complaint of some sort... the material seems cheap and my ears get warm, but I‚Äôd imagine that being normal with something covering ears. However, this is the best 30 bucks I‚Äôve spent in a while and I‚Äôd definitely refer these to a friend or family member not wanting to spend all that money on those other brands.

Review Contents: As you can see from the title, I'm not a big headphone person. I wanted a cheap set for working around the shop and bringing to work (I have downtime sometimes lol). Needless to say, I'm very happy with my purchase. The noise cancelling functions very well, the volume is great, unit fits comfortably. The build seems to be of good quality. My only gripe is the volume and pairing buttons on the side of the headset, when you click them up and down they are VERY loud inside the unit. This is not really a issue to me personally. If you're looking for headphones for professional recording or something of that sorts,these probably aren't for you. But for a cheap, good quality set of headphones, they're excellent! Very happy with my purchase! Oh did I mention the battery life is excellent?

Review Contents: Not bad for the price, I would not pay over the $37 that I did.  Sound quality is ok.  They fit very tight, I'm hoping they loosen up in the future more than an hour with these and you will have a headache, I do have glasses so they really dig into the temple.  I have an average sized head and they fit that tight.  So if you have a larger sized head I would say stay away.  Don't turn them on when you have them on your head, they will tell you when they connect and turn on or off as well as disconnect, at full volume.  This is being said by someone that likes loud car audio.I would have given 2 stars if I would have had to have paid more than the $37, gave 4 due to bang for buck.  Lets face it these are a $37 pair of blue tooth headphones with noise canceling and a microphone.

Review Contents: Update 1/13/18 I'm currently watching a different tv with the same fire stick as Bluetooth connection and have no trouble at all with the connection. Its a nice and newer tv that's the only thing I can think of. Also the company did reach out to me and had excellent customer service so I'm changing my rating because they do work with my one tv.Initial review: Unfortunately, while this does connect fine to my amazon fire stick so I can watch tv in my bedroom, the audio cuts in and out and my tv is maybe 12 feet away. I tested it the same evening by switching to watching the same thing on my phone and audio was fine. I am giving it one star because that is what I needed these for. I have worn them to workout and they were fine for the price but the buttons are definitely the biggest drawback, as I read in another review they feel cheap and there's no raised feature so you can feel what you're trying to control. The sound is fine. Bass is nothing like beats but for the price it's fine. I'll be giving these to my daughter who doesn't need them to watch tv so should be ok.
Title: wifi distance is lacking and control buttons are cheap

Review Contents: Trying to use on a Win 10 PC. The system is only able to register the mic after you restart your computer. Disconnecting/Turning off headphones AT ALL requires restarting your computer to connect.Device is locked at 1 Channel 8000 Hz (Phone Quality). This gives your voice and everything you hear the metallic and muffled sound of a telephone land-lineMicrophone simply won't work sometime and the only way to get the computer to recognize it is to restart your system.

Review Contents: DO NOT BUY THESE HEADPHONES IF YOU LIKE QUALITY SOUND IN MUSIC. I REPEAT.DO NOT BUY THESE HEADPHONES IF YOU LIKE QUALITY SOUND IN MUSIC.CONS-First of all, if you don't know what "EQ's" are, then you don't know the elements of sound and what to even listen for in music to determine if it is high quality or not. I ordered this item because I saw it had wonderful reviews. I was really skeptical because the reviews made these headphones seem like they were award-winning or some shit.-Everything about this headphone soundwise is completely off. The bass is overpowering. The vocals are compressed under the instrumentals. The treble is weak. Everything is off.-The volume is significantly lower when you Bluetooth compared to when you're using a wire.-I knew that good sound was not guaranteed since they were cheap, but Jesus Christ these were terrible. The other headphones I bought for around the same price (Ailihen) were way better.PROS-They look really nice.-They were very comfortable.
Title: DO NOT BUY THESE HEADPHONES IF YOU LIKE QUALITY SOUND IN MUSIC

Review Contents: I've had these for only about a week so far, so I can't speak to the durability or longevity of the product, but my first impressions of this are very high. For under $50 with bluetooth and being a lower tier brand, I was seriously expecting basic functionality with low to mid quality sound.I'm seriously impressed by the sound of these things. To put it bluntly: these are the best headphones I've ever had for under $100. Music sounds amazing on these. I put Spotify on (with high quality playback enabled) and took a tour through various styles including classical music, blues, jazz, and classic rock. I felt like I'd never listened to music before in my life. I felt like was transported to another place where I was standing in the middle of the band while they played all around me. I was surrounded by the music, with the various parts coming from different directions. Each instrument/vocal part could be individually distinguished from the others and sounded great. I heard things I'd never heard before from these songs. What you hear on the radio is just the tip of the iceberg for what is in these songs. I could hear background vocals, multiple different rhythm parts, the bass line, the violas and cellos distinct from the violins (in the classical music). It was incredible.The only other thing to say would be that they handled the full range of notes very well. From low basses to high notes I did not notice any points where they gave out. The basses sounded full and defined without just turning into a low growl, and the highs were clear without becoming tinny. And I didn't notice a difference in quality between being plugged in vs on Bluetooth. If anything, bluetooth may have performed better, but I'm not sure.
Title: Exceeded my expectations: Great for Music

Review Contents: ¬†I really like them . I bought them for my man. I will update my review after a while of using them. The reason I put three stars is because my man charged them when he first got them. He said he used them for maybe an hr and they were dead.  I got home and put them back in the charger and we left for about an hr and the red light went off indicating they were fully charged. So right now as I type I'm listening to them to see how long the battery lasts. If they last like they're suppose to then I will change the review to 5 stars. Now for the price I really like them so far(even more if the battery lasts). The sound quality is actually better than I expected. Really loud and the base is actually pretty good. I called my man with then and over the phone surprisingly the mic sounds really good. On the phone end it didn't sound too bad either(sounds just like talking on wired headphone with a mic) Over all so far I love them. My man likes them as well. I do plan on ordering another pair for myself. Just hoping the battery actually lasts like it's suppose to.

Review Contents: love these headphones !I ordered a different type prior to these (wireless earbuds) but unfortunately they kept falling out of my ears even though they were highly rated. They also kept cutting out. So after 2 days I returned those and bought these Mpow.While these are bulkier, they are WAY better. Obviously, they do not fall out of my ears (or feel like they're going to fall out)  and the sound quality is MUCH better. They did, however, cut out a slightly during the last minute or so of my walk to the gym but once I got inside, it was fine. Walking back was also fine so i'm not sure why the connection wasn't good before. Maybe some sort of interference ?They are also pretty good at blocking out noises in my gym and they fit comfortably, for the most part, on my ears for the duration of my workout (no longer than 2 hrs).These are also good for running - no sliding around or having to readjust anything.would def recommend this product if you are looking for inexpensive wireless headphones

Review Contents: I really like these headphones. Great price, great sound, battery life lasts me easily through a week of workouts on bluetooth (8-10 hours). Lose one star because they don't stay snuggly fit on your head during workouts. I have to constantly adjust it's position, regardless of how tight or loose i have it setup.Update: October, 16 2017So right after I gave a four star review, these headphones broke. The silver plastic piece that borders the control panel popped out, and when I popped it back in, two of the buttons don‚Äôt work (volume up and skip track). I dropped them from about thigh high. I knew these weren‚Äôt the toughest construction, but that‚Äôs pretty pathetic it broke that easily. I‚Äôm going to use the warranty I paid for to get another pair.Be wary of how cheap these are. I‚Äôm definitely thinking I should have just spent more money for more durable headphones.

Review Contents: I actually don't know where some of the praise comes from when other reviewers are comparing this headset with more high end headset because this headset sound quality doesn't even come close to my sony headset my dog, unfortunately, chewed up. I'm a VERY heavy music listener and I listen via Bluetooth. I don't know if its the bluetooth that the sound is coming in slightly muffled, and with 40% quality compared to my 5 year old sony headset, since I use the Amazon fire that they dumbed down the auxiliary port on where everything you plug in is muffled regardless of how expensive your headset is, so I can't see if its just the bluetooth that has the sound issues or just the headset in general. I'm going with the latter.
