Review Contents: I've only had these a short while, but I love them! They seem to last a long time on one charge. They were easy to connect to my Android. I like that there is a wire provided in case I was listening to a device that didn't have Bluetooth. At $35 I don't think the cost is too bad.I typically listen to podcasts rather than music. I'm not a sound expert by any stretch of the imagination. However, I've been very pleased with the sound quality on these.These are very comfortable. The only issue I've had is that if I'm wearing them with my glasses my head will start to hurt after 30 minutes or so. Though I think I will have this problem with any headphones, not just theses.

Review Contents: These headphones are AWESOME! I use them while I am at the gym and they do not slide or shift under impact of heavy movement. The charge seems to last much longer than the 13 hours it describes, as I have only had to charge them twice over the past month I have had them. That is using them close to 7 hours a week. The extra cord for plug in is great and I also use that too. The sound quality is good and the padding does a good job of blocking out external noises. It is not noise cancelling, but it might as well be. The buttons and construction of the headphones are well made and well done. The colors are as described and the blue is a very bright turquoise. I am very happy with how these headphones are made considering the price and would want to put them up against a very high end brand like Beats because the quality is nearly the same.

Review Contents: After reading from about 2,000 positive reviews on this product and watching countless You Tube video reviews and shootouts.I purchased during Amazon Black Friday Sale. I am very impressed with features considering the price:40 mm drivers deliver very decent bass and they come with a 13 hr, 420 mah battery!They have easy controls, compact to a foldable size and include both Blue tooth and 3.5 mm cable in the box.With the built in microphone you can utilize for phonecalls as well. There is even a female audible voice for commands.All in all, you cannot go wrong for budget minded BT headphones. I use these on my flights - I would buy again!

Review Contents: Comfort is AMAZING! Never had this much comfort in a headphone. I give it a 10, the sound quality is absolutely brilliant and hard to believe at this price point you can get that much bass and high fidelity, again, I give a 10. Price of product is definitely a 10, the only reason I gave 4 stars is the lack of volume. I will say it's plenty for average people but when I hear a favorite song, I'm an 80's kid... turning up the Walkman is what you do! But there just isn't much overhead for me. Nevertheless for the amazing price they will work wonderfully until I can save for some beats ($300) which other than the boost of volume I would get these would actually be all I need.
Title: Amazing for price! Very comfy!

Review Contents: My first try in the BT headphone market was a miss. I am actually shocked at how many positive reviews this has. Shocked! This product constantly stutters, or drops BT connection from from my Galaxy Note 8. The stutters are very quick, like a half a second each time, but it is by far enough to warrant a return. Also, the bass frequencies are horribly distorted (for my taste) even at low volume levels. I guess you definitely get what you pay for. I'll be spending more money to get better fidelity and connection.Otherwise pairing was easy with Android, and if you don't care about sound quality, or use them for voice only, they may be worth it to you for the price. Just don't expect pleasing HiFi music to pour through these.

Review Contents: These headphones have some extremely good qualities in them. For how inexpensive, they were, they are very durable and packs a punch with the audio quality for the price tag. They are extremely comfortable, have great sound, Bluetooth wireless, and their build quality is phenomenal. Once I put these on, I thought I purchased Boss or Beats. I do want to mention I am not an audiophile, but my sister thinks she is. I put a blindfold over her eyes, then put the headphones on her. I told her to listen to one song and to guess what kind headphones I purchased. After the song was over, she said ‚Äúwhy did you purchase a $200 headphone.‚Äù I laughed it off and took the blindfolded off of her. She guessed it was Beats, but was heavily surprised that it was a product not even on her radar. I am very satisfied with this product.

Review Contents: I was very disappointed with my experience with these headphones. I bought these headphones along with Mpow Bluetooth 4.1 Receiver & Transmitter to use on my TV in the hopes that I would reduce any pairing issues.I tried repeatedly to pair the two compatible devices several times and they would not pair even though it would indicate finding a device. I figured that I was doing something wrong even though the pairing is extremely straight-forward. I attempted to pair to my Computer & Cellphones hoping that I could rule out pairing issues and chalk it up to user error. Both my phones & computer was able to see the device, but when I would click to pair it would fail repeatedly. This is not rocket science and it should not have been this difficult in my opinion. I am assuming that it may be that the headphones were defective somehow and will attempt to exchange them for another and give it a second chance. I can't say much in the way of the transmitter as I was not able to fully use it, but I will exchange it as well just to be safe.That was my experience and not necessarily a Con, until I get the replacements and will update then.As for the Pro; These headphones are very comfortable and even while off they do a good job of reducing exterior noise with a good seal. They are very adjustable and my 10y.o. daughter & I both found them very comfortable & adjustable.UPDATE REVIEW 3/28/18I was contacted by Patozan about my poor rating review and I was issued a replacement. First of all I have to say that Patozan initiated the contact to address my poor findings and I applaud them for such professionalism, this is almost unheard of.I received my replacement headphones and immediately put them to charge to use them that very same day. I will admit that I was extremely surprised and how well they sounded. They have a great sound range and do very well Right to Left (Stereo or Staging) during usage. I opted to use Avantree transmitter https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B077MXFJGQ/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o09_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 instead of MPow transmitter (apparently no link available) and used the Digital Optical connection for best signal & sound results. The pairing of Avantree with thee headphones is total harmony and went without a hitch. I have not yet attempted to make additional connections as this is not their intended use, but plan on doing so soon and will make an update should it warrant it.Pros, easy to pair, sounds great, very good stereo/sound stagingPlease read Cons carefully. . . . .Cons are personal to me and don't necessarily reflect on the headphone; I find that the earphone cup is slightly small for my ears, but I do have ears on the slightly large side, the headphones also press against my head and cause me some discomfort, but I'm a chronic migraine sufferer and I'm somewhat sensitive to having things pressed to my head (I don't wear hats/caps due to this).Side note, I get an interruption for a second on occasion and I can't say whether it is the headphones or the transmitter or if this is simply an expected attribute for using this method to hear.
Title: Unable to pair, replacing them with update to come. UPDATE 3/28/18

Review Contents: They work just fine and are great for the price. They don't have some of the features that higher end headphones have like a strong bass boost or different sound options, but they work great! Easy to use and metal joint construction (as opposed to cheap plastic which breaks on other headsets) which is the most important feature for me and I didn't even know these had that when I ordered, so I am pleasantly surprised! NOTE: If using windows 10 I would recommend NOT using the CSR Harmony disc at all included with these. Windows 10 will keep the video and audio in sync when there is lag but the CSR Harmony drivers will not. They get out of sync when bluetooth experiences lag so do NOT install anything from the disc (disc comes in the package) and you will be very happy with these!

Review Contents: Update:  After my first review at a 3 due to muffled sound, the company contacted me and poof, a new set of headphones showed out at my house!  They apparently stand behind their product.  The new set sounds much better and I can give them a five star now, both because they are great and because the company clearly wants to do what is right.  Thanks!!!Product is just OK.  The fit is nice, I like the padding at the top.  The sound is good but sounds muffled, which is why I gave it three stars.  I can't explain why it has a strange muffled sound but it is noticeable when listening to music.  For the price however, its still a good deal, especially if you are using it for audio books or something that doesn't require perfect sound.I have been wearing the headphones while mowing my grass and find the noise canceling good.  I have to keep the volume up a little bit but not much higher than when listening on my couch.

Review Contents: Don't expect its bluetooth compatible with Mac or iPad. I tried it numerous times to pair it with my Mac via bluetooth. I even followed their instructions, but it just does not work. Their technical support feedbacks are also extremely slow, i.e. response given after a week and not helpful in remedying your technical problems. The specs also promote its ability to pair with 2 devices simultaneously. It really does, but say if I play a youtube video on phone A and a soundtrack on phone B, it can only play either thing at one time. When you turn the electronic gadget's bluetooth off and then on again, you need to manually turn off the headphone in order to pair them up, it cannot automatically reconnect to the gadget itself. As per the specs, it is for sports use, but the wet cushion will create discomfort and dermal irritability probably after doing sports. The quality of sound is acceptable, at least it will not be some mp3 quality. If one treats this for leisure  use, this is acceptable. However, if you expect this to be comparable with Beats, I recommend you to purchase Beats straight.

Review Contents: I purchased this a few weeks ago. I was excited to receive it because I wanted some nice earphones for when I'm writing. Drowning out the noises in my household is vital to my concentration. Well, due to the hurricane I had to wait almost two weeks to receive them. This was really upsetting. I ended up ordering another pair from Sony, so when these arrived much later, I ended up just giving them to my husband. He likes them a lot. He's been using them to connect to his PS4 controller, and now I don't complain about the volume being too loud. The price is decent and much less than the ones that I ended up getting, so they are a great buy.

Title: headphones work fine, overall satisfied

Review Contents: Pros:Very nice, high-quality headphones. The sound quality is great. They work great for talking on the phone, no one that I spoke with noticed I was using the headphones, and some stated that I sounded more clear than usual. The battery life is exceptional. I got the headphones Friday when I got home from work and I haven't had to charge them this entire week (its Friday 7 days later now). I also used the headphones extensively to and from work (hour drive each way) and some when at home. It's very convenient to be able to answer the call by just pressing the button on the right headphone without having to look at your phone. Also you can skip to the next song or previous song with buttons on the side. They even come with a 3.5mm jack so you can use them that way without draining battery as well.Cons:This isn't really a con, but it is worth noting that if you are buying these for gaming on a PC, they need to be plugged in to work properly due to Bluetooth limitations. For example, while using Bluetooth the headphones can't use the mic and have stereo sound at the same time. If you're using the mic on PC, it will automatically switch to mono, which severely reduces sound quality.

Review Contents: I have to give it 4 stars. The brand and the headphones are great. I highly recommend MPOW BLUETOOTH HEADPHONES.The reason for the 4 stars is doe to miss leading information and not real clear of what you would need as far as connecting to your TV. I bought these for my TV, on the bottom of page it said, COSTUMERS ALSO BOUGHT TOGETHER so my understanding was if i purchase the headphones and bluetooth adapter i would be able to connect these headphones to my smart tv. The adapter that was shown will not work with the tv. What was missing is the correct information. If you buy these for any TV make sure you get the correct adapter,which is nothing what COSTUMERS ALSO BOUGHT. BUT OTHERWISE IT IS A GREAT SET.

Review Contents: Honestly, I could do without all of the wireless headphones stuff because all I wanted was a cheap pair of headphones that would produce good sound. Unfortunately, these are not those headphones. The mids are completely lacking in this headphones and sound extremely muddy. For videogames this isn't that bad, but any human voices sound like they're speaking through tubes. Music is just plain awful with these headphones but at least they do okay in games. I still get the feeling I'm missing things though so I think I'll replace these headphones with a better pair in the near future.I will say, the headphones are pretty comfortable though and they look good. I guess you get what you pay for...

Review Contents: These are okay as headphones, but terrible as a headset. I was hoping to use them for web conference calls and video streaming, but the microphone quality is so bad I sound like I'm underwater. My webcam mic produces clearer audio.Update: I was contacted by the seller, Patozon,and offered an alternate headset that might better suit my needs.I chose this one:¬†Mpow USB Headset/ 3.5mm Computer Headset with Microphone Noise Cancelling , Lightweight PC Headset Wired Headphones, Business Headset for Skype, Webinar, Phone, Call Center¬†I was hoping for a wireless option, but this does have a much better mic. I'm a bit disappointed they didn't send the color I requested (I asked for white, they sent black)- appearance was important to me since I do plan on using this for video streaming- but it will serve my purposes. I increased the rating on this review to reflect their positive customer service.I recommend the MPOW 059 bluetooth headset if you are using it strictly as headphones or for cellphone conversations. It seems to work quite well for that, and it's very portable. Avoid and pick up an alternative such as the above if you need higher quality mic audio for professional settings.
Title: Avoid if looking for a quality microphone

Review Contents: Shockingly low fidelity.for an "iMPRESSIVE SOUND QUALITY".  Compared to my wired Grado headset, this has a muffled sound, unsuitable for TV dialogues.  Admittedly the Grado is a high end reference unit, so I compared the Mpow against a low cost plantronic headset meant for voice communication.  Again, the Mpow sounded muffled, distant sounding suggesting a very poor frequency balance.with some nasty resonance.  In my opinion, It is unsuitable for communication and unsuitable for music listening.  But if you don't mind true fidelity, the sound cancelling feature may be sufficient reason to buy this mediocre headphone.

Review Contents: Frankly speaking, this headphone is way better than the Bose headset I have bought from Costco for $100+. It is also comfortable even if I am wearing my glasses.  In my experience, the output sound is louder when using the cord instead of bluetooth.  The only downside of this product is that you use your phone device to answer, call, or control your headphones when it is wired.  This is the readon why my rating is only 4 stars.  Otherwise, this is a good buy!  Score!

Review Contents: These headphones are very comfortable and connected easily.  I like the type of controls these have.  I bought them because I kept getting tangled in the cord to my laptop, with my corded headphones, and I accidentally pulled my laptop off the desk and damaged it.  I really like these and now I don't have to worry about the cord since these are Bluetooth.  These DO come with a roughly 4 ft long,  3.5 mm-jack cord for corded use if you want it.  There is a detailed instruction book, but the print is so small you will need sophisticated military equipment in order to read it.  I managed, even so.

Title: Four Stars

Review Contents: Amazing headphones - wonderful audio quality, great mic for phone calls, quite effective at noise-blocking, and long battery life. I have used these for conference calls at work and nobody has ever told me that my audio was poor quality and a few people I asked said the audio quality was great. When I use these to listen to audiobooks and podcasts on outdoor walks, I can hear remarkably well without having to put the volume high at all, even if I'm on a busy road with loud cars. On the same roads, I was not able to hear at all when I used ear buds or another Bluetooth device that goes in one ear only.Incredibly convenient having bluetooth. I can put my phone down in my apartment and listen to audio with these in most parts of my apartment without having to haul my phone around with me. Great for listening to audio when cooking because they are obviously cordless, especially when I cannot blast audio because my partner is studying nearby. Also, if she is listening to an audio lecture outloud practically right next to me, I can listen to my own audio without hearing her audio because these headphones effectively block external noise (even though they're not full noise-cancelling headphones).For those of us who like to listen to audiobooks and podcasts and many different situations, these are truly life changers!
Title: Amazing headphones - wonderful audio quality

Review Contents: 4th pair of Mpow brand earphones i have bought, i am really impressed with these. Review Contents: UPDATE: Now they blame there problem of sending me the wrong headphones on me!  If you are smart run away now. Junk headphones, junk service.NEWEST-Promised replacement- 20 days later I reminded them. Excuses was "none in stock" but now they sent them.  Arrived 2days ago and...WRONG HEADPHONES!  HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICEPros: Look niceCons: Everything else.1st these ARE NOT OVER THE EAR HEADPHONES.  The only ears these can fit over are a small child's ears and even then you may have to fold the ears to get them into the headphones.  Most over the ear headphones are at least 2.5inches long (inner measurement), these are well short of that.2nd My headphone at least are not balanced correctly.  I can hear a lot more sound coming from the right ear than the left.  Does not happen with my other two headphones so its not my phone or av equipment.3rd THESE ARE ON THE EAR HEADPHONES.  Looking over the reviews (a bit late now) I notice that the company that sells them either doesn't understand what over the ear means, or does, but blames the fault on some outside manufacturer.  Since no one that complains that these are not over the ear ever comes back to say they got a new pair with bigger cans I can only assume that a manufacture problem is just an excuse for "we made these wrong but we are going to keep selling them anyway."4th These CAN NOT be used to make or take phone calls.  The mic must be too far away or it's just a cheap mic but even talking very loudly people can barely hear me when I talk.  My cheapo 20 on-ears are crystal clear compared to these higher priced monsters.They should just label them accurately and call them on the ear headphones, then I wouldn't have wasted my time buying, getting upset and wasting time writing this review, and now returning these lying headphones.
Title: NOT OVER THE EAR - LIES! Horrible customer service! RUN! FAKE reviews!

Review Contents: I like um. It was fairly easy to pair them to a tablet. They are very nice looking and feel pretty sturdy. I bought them for my son who has notoriously broken every pair he's ever owned. So far, so good. The earphones themselves are pretty big and are comfy to me but my kid said that after a while they "smoosh" his ears. Could be just him and his big ol' ears or maybe they are a lil "smooshy" on the ears...I dunno.  My kid said they can get pretty loud with the volume turned up and the noise reduction is pretty good. All in all for the price these headphones are pretty great. I will update if things change.

The instructions are pretty basic, but sufficient for most things. There's a little more bass than I'm used to, but I think that's a case of me being more used to earbuds. Some have complained about fit/tightness. At first I thought that might be an issue for me, but I've found that I can usually adjust the band to get an acceptably comfortable fit.

Review Contents: When operated in wired mode and listening to music the quality is good. When used in blue tooth mode using their dongle the quality is poor. It is in the background and not clear or crisp. It's like listening to a radio in a tunnel. I've contact the manufacturer to see if something can be corrected. If not they are going back.The problem wound up being that the dongle was plugged into a hub. There should be a notice in the direction that the dongle needs to be plugged in to a primary USB port that is connected directly to the motherboard.

Review Contents: If you're expecting a High-end Deep-bass Studio quality headphone, you're about to get disappointed. This is an above-average pair of headphones. I was expecting it to sound nearly as clear and neat as my Behringer HPS3000 (Which costs about 19 bucks and sounds wonderfully good for such a low price) but these are way below that. A little bit muffled in my opinion... However, i'm going to be using these to avoid unnecessary chatter in the gym. I hope gym-talkers get the message once they see me wearing bright-red headphones. For this use, these headphones work very well.The ear pads are VERY comfortable, thats a plus.The top glossy part is a fingerprint Magnet, so beware of smudges and greasy edges once you've used them for a while. Not quite the best material choice.

Review Contents: These Bluetooth over ear headset delivers very well especially for the price. They're a little heavier than I wanted them to be but I go back to how much they cost: they were cheap. They deliver great sound, have an excellent battery life and the controls are fairly easy to use. Unfortunately they don't keep out all that external noise, primarily I assume because they are not noise canceling: again they are cheap. Bottom line if you don't care about canceling out that train noise on the subway and only use them maybe an hour or so at a time these are right for you. My ears get tired after about an hour, but I must say I am a bit of an ear baby.

Review Contents: I really wanted to believe these were great headphones. I read the reviews, did my research, etc. I only used them one time and had to send them back. I tried recharging, etc., but they still didn't work.I'm updating my initial review...Mpow staff saw my review and sent me another set of headphones. I am extremely pleased with the product/sound quality. I took a week testing them to make sure they'd work during chemotherapy, and they did. I bought wireless headsets for the convenience, and they were the perfect companion during my infusion. For whatever reason, I'm not always able to use one of my hands, and these headsets solved that problem.I couldn't be more pleased with the outcome...thanks, Mpow.

Review Contents: Update as of 11/4/17I think this company reads everyone's review and saw that I had a defective on this Mpow 059.  They reached out to me and made things right by offering a replacement.  I was sent a Mpow H2.  This H2 is working really well.  Customer Service from this company is top notch.  You can be confident buying things from them and they will take good care of you if you have issues.  Therefore, I'm uping the stars.This headset feels heavy and uncomfortable to me.  I was testing it out by leaving a voicemail on a phone and when I went to check on the receiving device there was none so I'm guessing the mic is not working.  When I wear it to listen to music for awhile it makes my head feels hot so I can't stand having this on for more than 15 minutes.  Guess it's onto searching for another headset for.

Review Contents: I have always owned Beats over the ear headphones. My Beats began tearing so I had to superglue them back together. I always have my headphones on while walking to and from class every day. It‚Äôs my way of drowning out the world around me. I wanted headphones that are Bluetooth since having a cord gets in the way when I have my phone in my pocket. I couldn‚Äôt afford Bluetooth Beats so I purchased these and I am highly satisfied. I personally think the sound quality is better, these are far more stylish, and I have never had a problem with Bluetooth connection. Overall, I would recommend these over any other wireless over the ear headphones.

Review Contents: For the price, better than I expected. You can tell they put more money into comfort and strength than audio quality and bluetooth range. You have aluminum hinges (Not cheap aluminum either). Good quality plastic (Not the brittle crappy plastic). The ear cups are comfortable. It took four hours to *feel* the headphones, and then I just adjusted them on my skull and went another 4 hours.The mic quality is about the same as a decent logitec for twice the cash.Pairs to multiple devices.The set is screwed together with torx bits! If you wanted to improve the audio quality by slipping in better drivers / wires, you totally could, if you were so inclined.Their engineer deserves a handshake.

Review Contents: THESE HEADPHONES ARE WELL WORTH THE MONEY! They work great, very nice quality and they are super cheap compared to Beats by Dre and other popular headphones being sold for $200+. I call these "Cheaps by Dre". haha Been using corded headphones for years, and to switch to these Bluetooth headphones is liberating! No getting tangled in cords anymore! Sound is pretty decent on these. Not pro-audiophile quality but it gets the job done.  The only negative I can say is that when using it as  Bluetooth headset  with iPhone, my wife says I don't sound that clear on when I speak to her on a phone call. Other than that, these things are legit!

Review Contents: I wish I could give a good review for these headphones.  They sounded great, looked nice, and are very portable, but there's just one problem.  They didn't hold a charge.  They are bluetooth headphones, implying that you should be able to listen to them without wires, right?  Well seeing as my pair didn't hold a charge, I couldn't very well use them wirelessly now could I?  I've since returned these for a pair of Cowin E7's.EDIT:Since posting this review, Mpow has been kind enough to send me a new pair of headphones, these ones seem to work as intended.  However, seeing as I have already purchased and grown accustomed to a new pair of headphones (as stated earlier, the Cowin E7's) I will not be using this pair that Mpow has sent me.  I will instead be giving them to someone as a Christmas/birthday gift.  As I stated earlier in the review, the headphones are great for the price, but the pair I ordered happened to be DOA.  This just goes to show how great Mpow's customer service is that I was able to receive a new pair of headphones despite the fact that I have already returned the DOA pair and received a refund from Amazon.

Review Contents: I was wondering how loud they would actually be for Bluetooth technology under $40.  They look cool for sure abs have gotten compliments at the gym but you will get some ear discomfort after 60-90min.  And not from 'pounding bass' I wish.  But they do hit on the lower end, but overall, as an old school D&B DJ they just don't have the volume I'm looking for...  You can't beat the price though.  On the plus side I've had zero issues with  performance due to perspiration.  I train hard in the FL sun and they stay functional while sweating.  Bluetooth range is 15-20 ft.

Review Contents: I was delighted to find the Mpow Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones after searching the grid for functional ones that would fit my budget. I've been using the headphones for about 2 weeks now with very few complaints. The sleek design looks very nice while wearing and the earpieces are comfortable. The headphones will fit all head lengths with the easily adjustable sides. They come with a carrying pouch, instructions, cable to listen wired, and charging cable. The sound quality is very good, but not amazing, as you can't hear all that much bass when listening to music. I felt that the lack of bass hasn't at all interfered with my listening experience, which is good. One complaint I have is regarding the Bluetooth connection. The instructions say how to connect the headphones with up to two devices at once, but whenever I try to do this and connect my iPad, my phone disconnects, and then I later have to reconnect it, which can be a tedious process, thus taking away a star. Overall, I really like this product and would recommend to those who are interested in affordable, high- quality headphones.

Title: Great

Review Contents: Overall, you're getting good quality for paying under $40. They're comfortable, but the headphones start to like pinch the ear after awhile, so it's hard to go over an hour without wanting to take them off for a small break. The buttons for the bluetooth work and the voice is handy, but the buttons do feel a little cheap and it worries me how long my power button will work. Also, when using bluetooth, there's definitely some pausing/lagging/whatever that goes on. It works well enough to be worth using, but it is a slight annoyance. The wired jack it comes with in case you don't want to use bluetooth or it's out of battery is really nice. I feel confident that even if the bluetooth function eventually fails me, I'll get a long lifespan using it wired.

Review Contents: Very disappointed with MpowI have ordered several Mpow products and really like them. The problem is this appears to be a used pair. The headphones were in a bubble pocket that wasn't even sealed or taped, just folded over. They had no plastic covering on them. You know, the sticky plastic film that is on new electronics. Nothing. Just folded up and put in a loose bubble wrap . The box also contained the cabling in a little ziploc and the instructional manual. My wife was standing there when I opened it and even she commented about how "That's how they packed it? This was obviously opened before." I will be returning, and maybe looking at some of the competitors for the replacement. Not really sure if I want to go through the hassle of returning these and ordering a new pair and risking it has been opened before too.UPDATE:  For some reason Amazon won't accept my previous review.  No profanity or disrespect, so not sure why.

Review Contents: I bought this headset after my kitten destroyed my last pair. I figured wireless would be the way to go and this head set has been helpful in my situation. Except....Cons:Using the BT microphone causes all sound quality to drop to phone call quality.I would knock off more stars, but this is a common occurrence with Bluetooth headsets. It's a bit disappointing that I will need to purchase a separate microphone for gaming and chatting at the same time. If you need a headset with microphone, you need to ditch Bluetooth.

Review Contents: I love these headphones. I have a smaller head and these sit comfortably on my head without slipping. My partner has a much larger head and they fit them no problem. They have clear sound quality and really help block out other noise. They have a decent range of well over 80 feet before it was breaking up. My only cons, which aren't actually cons, are that there is voice notifications that are loud but meh. Also, while wearing the headphones it is hard to feel which buttons are which. I was hoping that there would be a little texture to help tell the difference between the 2 buttons.Great headphones especially for the price point. I will update when I see how long the battery lasts.

Title: Save Your Money

Review Contents: Love them
Title: Five Stars

Review Contents: I was looking for a low cost, well built headphone for my young ones.  I needed it to be bluetooth compatible and easy to use.  Instead what I received was a cool red, smoothly designed, comfortable pair of over the ear headphones.  It was unexpected.  The sound quality is amazing (throw your BE-TS away).  Here's an example: I was listening to music from my television on the second floor, but needed a snack (who doesn't?), so I went down the hall, then downstairs, and found myself in front of the ice-box (refrigerator) for my treat.  That's where I realized that the Mpow was the little headphone that could.  The music was crystal clear and loud (no one around at that time).  I had forgotten that I was listening to the upstairs music using the headphones (i.e., it is lightweight, so comfortable, and no loss of signal) which makes for the perfect headphones you can buy.  I don't believe in >100% (200% effort, etc.), but if there was a 5+, I'd be deserving.

I generally use them for two things: Work conference calls or spinning cycle at the gym. For Work conference calls, the call quality couldn‚Äôt be better. I can hear and be heard very clearly. For the spinning bike, the music sound quality is great and I feel as if I‚Äôm really at a gym with an instructor and music blaring. The charge holds for a very long time as well. I had originally thought about buying very expensive Bose wireless headphones, but when I saw the great reviews, I decided to give these a shot. I‚Äôm very glad I did. I couldn‚Äôt be happier with them.

Review Contents: I've been on a bit of a bluetooth headphone buying binge lately to try to find something that's comfortable, affordable, looks good, and sounds good.  I think I've found it with these headphones.  From the moment I put them on my head they felt very comfortable.  As a glasses wearer, these headphones continue to feel comfortable, even after extended wearing time (other glasses wearers will understand what I mean).  They paired up with my phone with no issues.  The sound quality seems good to me, but I'm not an audiophile.  These headphone have an amazing value, and I would recommend them to anyone looking for a good set without breaking the bank.
Title: Great looks, comfort, quality, and value.

Review Contents: they sound fine, plugged in...I was able to connect to Bluetooth with my 5 year old laptop.....however I have not to date been able to stop the stuttering, which, after researching, seems like a common problem.......with many head sets.....I tried every fix recommended....that I was able to do without getting into deep stuff, like working on the router......anyway....they sound good and are reasonably comfortable...plugged in...........

Review Contents: I love the cost of these headphones.I love the sound.Love how quickly it charges. Overall A+.However, small details that do bother me...how bulky it is. it does collapse and fits into its bags, which I hardly use. I use this headphones quite often.Also, the buttons on the side are loud. Every click can be heard from others around on and of course you with the headphones on.I have had a few connectivity issues with it wanting to pair when I didn't want it too.Also, love that you can still listen even when its charging.

Review Contents: Muddy sound, very uncomfortable gave me a headache after wearing halfway through the first song I tried to listen to, returned same day.

IF YOU WEAR HATS - as I do - always - these are quite "large" in size but very comfortable {unless you're a hat} - I will search for a similar item that solves my issue as I do not like things "in" my ears - I sent them back immediately and have to valuable feedback on the microphone quality and such - just know they are comfortable for the brief time I wore them but Very Very Large compare them to my studio ear cans which are huge - so ...
Title: Physically very large but comfy

Review Contents: Love it
Title: Five Stars

Review Contents: This is a good headphone to me, I meant I know what I am going to do with this headphone. I only use this headphone to connect to my cellphone for calling people, then I can do household chore while talking on the phone. I have a audio-technica headphone, so of course I won't compare this to that since I am not using this headphone for music.I don't have to charge it often, I have used it several times, everytime the call last at least 1 hour. I haven't had the need to recharge it.BTW, the foldable design is great!So far it serves the purpose I need, I am glad I bought this headphone.

Review Contents: For the price, these sound very good. It took several times to get paired, but once paired they have stayed paired. I adjusted my laptop's sound for more bass, making them sound even better. They seem like they are made well, and can be adjusted to fit snugly. I like the option to use Bluetooth or wire. Pleased with purchase.
Title: these sound very good. It took several times to get paired

Review Contents: Great headphones! The sound quality is great and the controls are easy to use. I got these as a gift for my husband. He doesn't care for earbud style headphones, so he loves these! He uses them mostly while he is at the gym, and he says they fit well. My husband liked them so much that he bought me a pair! They can get uncomfortable to your ears if you wear them for extended periods of time, but it's not terrible. Overall, great quality at a great price, and I'd definitely buy these again.
Title: Like Them A Lot!

Review Contents: This does not pair with my iPad Air.  It works on my iPhone 7.  Will try again, if not I will return this.
Title: Does not pair with iPad

Review Contents: These headphones are a decent build quality for the price. They have been very reliable for my 11 year old son. We haven't had them long enough to test the battery runtime, but the battery seems reliable also. As an audio engineer I feel that the audio quality is lacking, but my standards are higher than most. They audio is clear and fairly full range. It lacks the low end punch that kids might be looking for, but otherwise is probably a reasonably flat response.
Title: Great wireless headphones for the price!

Review Contents: I bought these for my 11 year old daughter and she loves them. She uses them with the cord for playing games on her computer and connected via bluetooth for listening to music on her phone. They work great for both. They block out the noise for her, but she can still tell we're talking to her if we raise our voices. The sound quality is very good and the construction is very sturdy. Shipped quickly and came exactly as described.
Title: They work great for both

Review Contents: Works just fine.  Looks good, sounds great.WildI appreciate the notice on turning the unit Off & On.  Is it possible to add instructions for the rest of the functions that are easier to read, perhaps a link that was accessible online?  Right now I have tried to recharge and I am not having that happen.Thanks for your concern and I look forward to further instructions,  Wild
Title: Five Stars

Review Contents: These are extremely boomy and make a lot of "bass" noise that is not musical. Most of the bass range must be cut down with an equalizer just to make them listenable so that one can hear the midrange and highs.
Title: Bass distortion

Review Contents: I was looking for headphones under $50 with decent sound quality that would be comfortable for hours at a time.+ The Price was great+ They block a lot of outside soundBut....- They squeezed my (big) head to hard- They do not quite go all the way around my ear, so they squish/pinch my ears- The sound quality was disappointing/muffled- When I walked around the house wearing them my footsteps made a loud thumping sound in my head.
Title: ... under $50 with decent sound quality that would be comfortable for hours at a time

Review Contents: I bought these to use at work. My office is a big open space and sometimes the background noise of other people chatting and working makes it difficult to focus. The earphones that come with my phone weren't helpful in blocking enough of that noise out. These headphones block out enough noise that I can focus on my work, but still hear if someone approaches my desk and talks to me.
Title: Blocks just the right amount of noise

Review Contents: Sounds great and looks great all the features you need, wish there was more bass though
Title: Affordable and Good

Review Contents: These headphones are fantastic. My ten year old twins have broken every pair of headphones on the market (well under $60). These headphones are very high quality. I have $300 Bose headphones so I know what sounds terrible and what sounds pretty good. The only reason why I'm not giving it five starts is because each one is supposed to come with the package bag and one was missing one
Title: Fantastic headphones. One tiny issue

Review Contents: Great set for the money. Easy pairing on multiple devices, lightweight, and very comfortable. I bought them for listening to talks and taking online courses and for that they are drop dead perfect. Music quality is good to very good, but for superior sound you'll have to pay more. These are good, but the true audiophile might wish to go up a notch. Then again, maybe my sound card could be better.
Title: Great set for the money

Review Contents: They worked great for about 2 months, then they just quit working. I can get them to turn on and turn off but they will no longer pair with anything.Update: I was contacted by their customer service and sent out a new pair. New pair arrived in working condition and so far no complaints.
Title: They worked great for about 2 months

Review Contents: Not horrible but it wasn't worth buying. I would rather pay more and get something more comfortable.
Title: One Star

Review Contents: Exactly as described! I use these every day. The sound quality is way better than i expected. And the battery life is ridiculous on them! I will turn them on before bed, forget to turn them off in the morning, and they will still have plenty of battery left when i get home in the evening. The only thing I wish they had was an auto shut off. But again, with such a long battery life it hasn't actually posed a problem. Would just be nice. Love these things!Also, they have decent range on them. I havnt tested the limits, but I know i can walk about 18 ft away from the phone and shut the door and still talk on them just fine.The Mic seems to pick up my voice very well, even when i speaking quietly.
Title: Amazing for the price!

Review Contents: These are very reasonable priced headphones.  They work well and the sound is really good.  I am sure the sound is not like really expensive headphones, but they are wonderful for what I use them for.  I use them to watch TV after my husband goes to bed.  He has really keen hearing, so  I thought he deserved for me to get something so that he is not bothered.  I really like the sleek design and the fact that they fold.  After I got everything hooked up correctly, they paired with my device with no problem.  I intend to take them on vacation too.  They paired with my iPad and I can do CE in Molecular Biology in spare time.  It is always hard to do it on work days and I really enjoy reading and learning.  I was having a problem at first getting them paired and the company was very fast getting back with me.  There are also videos on You Tube that are very helpful.  I typed in Sony Bravia and wireless headphones and it took me to my solution.  Gotta love You Tube.  I am so glad that I purchased these after much research and my need to keep my costs as low as possible.  They seem well built.  Time will tell about that, but I don't expect any problems.
Title: Wonderful Headphones.  So glad I purchased them.

Review Contents: These worked until September 15.  5 days after return window closed and 35 days after ordering.  Order something else.  These have serious issues.
Title: Don't waste your money

Review Contents: The music quality was better than a cheap pair of headphones.  I just couldn't stand that walking with them on was a no - it's so loud; you can hear every step thud in your ears.  Also, if your music stops and you just want to keep them on without playing anything, you can hear your heart beating pretty loudly. I know...weird...maybe that's a normal thing with headphones?  I just think these could "breath" more to prevent those sounds.You can hear the outside world with them on - even people talking with relatively quiet voices.  If you go past the mid-level of volume, others can hear your music.
Title: Ok quality but some issues

Review Contents: My 4th day using the headset and it's worked amazing on the bluetooth.  people report my voice sounding a touch tinny and echoy, but it's a sub $100 headset, so I can live with that.  Sound on playback is really nice.  Bass was surprisingly strong.  My only complaint with it is that the Audio cable that came with it is 3 pole, not 4.  Being an iphone user, that means it will be using the mic built into the phone, not the one in the headset if I take a call with it wired.  Is this what it was supposed to come with?
Title: My 4th day using the headset and it's worked amazing on the bluetooth

Review Contents: They feel solid and well made, battery life is very good, and the sound quality is better than anything I've had without spending upwards of $100 or more. They are comfortable to wear for extended periods and are fairly low profile for over the ear phones. They have a little weight to them which also contributes to the overall feel of a quality product.
Title: Very happy with these!

Review Contents: Disclaimer - i have a giant-sized noggin :-oThis is an attractive, well-packaged device which charges quickly, come with USB charge cable. Audio quality is good and it comes with an audio 3.5mm plug (male to male) to attach directly. The built-in mic is very good but apparently only active in Bluetooth mode not direct plugin. My wife now wants one... and she has a normal sized noggin, she‚Äôs likely to get this one ;-)
Title: Good, stylish product, a little small

Review Contents: The Bluetooth connection is solid but the headphones leave much to be desired. The quality of the sounds is not great and needed alot of tuning with the phone equalizer to sound decent. Turning them on and off is a chore because they will sometimes go into pairing mode and you have to let off the power button and hold it down again to get it to work.
Title: The quality of the sounds is not great and needed alot of tuning with the phone equalizer ...

Review Contents: Let me start by saying, for the money you pay these will do for any need.  They have decent sound and feel comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.  The reason I gave 2 stars was because this seems to be yet another case of "review grouping"!  What I mean by that is based off the many many reviews and star count this listing showed this product had, which I have a hard time believing are just for this product, I bought these.  I can't speak for anyone else but as an avid audiophile, I know of and actually posses better sounding headphones that are at the same price point.  Some of those product are still on Amazon and they don't have near as many reviews as this one had.  I don't like this practice as it can be very misleading for the consumer.  I'm sure it works wonders for the sellers. This is just a warning that you cannot rely on the number of reviews and high star value alone!Anyway, the bass is not great and the speakers tend to distort at around 75% or more for bass heavy music.  This may ruin your experience if you are a audiophile like me. The midrange is also too low which make the high scream.  This make the sound uneven and empty at times even when you back off the volume.  I'm sure Mpow has some headphones that will knock your socks off but these are not the ones!Update!  The customer service at Patozon is Great.  They recognized my frustration with these headphones and sent me a different pair that are a lot better.  These (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B074R94LFQ) are more of what I would have expected with the high number of reviews these previous ones had.  These new ones have pretty good bass after you play with some of the EQ settings on your device.  I was able to get these to sound pretty good for the price.  Highs are very good and I had to find a preset EQ type to dial them back a little but I do like the clarity of the highs.  The midrange is decent and goes well with the total range of the the headphones.  The bass is punchy and only when turned all the way up, which is a lot, do they start to distort.  I like that you can turn them up when you really want to feel some vibration.  They seem very sturdy and the comfort is just as good as the previous ones.  You want to get these for the price instead of the MPBH059AG ones of this original review.
Title: Updated: Classic case of "Review grouping" in my opinion!

Review Contents: these are really nice headphones, really surprised by the sound from a cheap set of blue tooth headphones. i wear them when working out,they don't cause my ears to sweat and they stay in place. nice to not deal with a cord.
Title: these are really nice headphones, really surprised by the sound from a ...

Review Contents: Very nice. Comfortable for my 12 & 4 year old girls and myself  (I'm a large man with a very large head). Plenty of volume with excellent sound quality. Decent range on the Bluetooth. Good battery life. I am a truck driver and listen to it at least 10 hours per day on a single charge. Works well for phone calls even in the noisy truck. Great buy for the money! I will be gifting these headsets to several people next Christmas!

Title: Headphones broke after 6 months.

Review Contents: I bought these to cancel out noise, play music, and watch study aids. It worked well for a while. The problems started three weeks in when I was in the library and there was a delay or a stutter from where the video was to when I was hearing them speak. This only occurred while using the bluetooth function. When I would use the aux chord it worked fine. Then at the end of my seventh week of school the left speaker, there one with the aux plug in, started to make fizzle and popping noises. The noise would sometimes stop when I would adjust the speaker and it would completely end the sound or it would stop the crackling and work fine. As the weeks progressed it got worse and now its a big pain. I am not going to deal with this anymore and scrapping the headphones.

Great customer service, and of course the headphones are a delight. I would recommend them now.--I am pretty disappointed with these headphones. They had good sound quality and paired easily with my computer, but about three months into using them the right speaker stopped functioning. I've tried to contact the manufacturer as advised, but no response. Will change my review if they do, but until then this looks like a fail.
Title: Good headphones until they broke

Review Contents: Sound is pretty good for around  $40.  You'll have to adjust your cell for more bass. The earcups are very soft and comfortable.  While not memory foam they do a pretty good job blocking out a noisy gym.  The top strap doesn't squeeze your head like other comments noted (and I've got a big head), so maybe it's been redesigned.  I wouldn't suggest it for vigorous activity; it can slip off.
Title: Pretty good for $40.

Review Contents: Good construction, my last pair had a weak band that broke over time from flexing. These have a much stronger band, and in reality too strong so I took a star. They dont go over my ears completely they compress parts of my ears against my head and it gets uncomfortable over long periods. I dont have big ears either, tgese just have small earbud sizes on them. Sound is good, bass isnt as good as my older pair of headphones but the sound quality is just fine for this price range.
Title: No bad at all

Review Contents: The sound from this set is awesome.  They fit well and are very comfortable to wear, I use them everyday on my way to/from work which is a total of 2 hours.  I charged them once and have used them all week without recharging yet.

It was easy to charge and pair to the ipad.  Again, tested before packing up.  :)  I am thinking this will work better than the corded headsets we have been burning through.
Title: This will work great for my 5 year old

Review Contents: Sound quality 5/5 pretty good for the costComfort with glasses 3/5 presses my glasses into my skull, but I don't expect muchVolume control 1/5 - can get very loud,  but it's soft end is lacking.Portability 5/5 can foldBluetooth ability 5/5 good sound quality for when I'm in another roomUsability- 5/5 very simple set upOverall they're pretty good. Review Contents: The actual item was not as described although they have since changed that. If I could give 5 stars for the seller I would. They went over and above to meet my needs. That is fine customer service so while the product did not meet my expectations, the customer service by the seller exceeded my expectations.  If you don't need the noise cancelling feature these headphone were great. Paired easily, decent sound quality and a long battery life.

Title: Five Stars

I have an average sized head but have to pull the earpieces down as far as they go. May not fit others.

I also get headaches if I wear for a certain period of time. But the sound is good, audio cable is very flexible and durable (I've tugged on it so many times lol). Haven't used its Bluetooth as that's not why I bought it. Passive Noise-cancelling can still hear around me but can hear myself more if I speak with them on. It's probably better for heads who have shorter hair or doesn't wear twists or braids.

Review Contents: Fast shipping. And the headphones have the look, feel and sound of expensive headphones, but without the expensive price. They are very good headphones that I use while working out and just working. Also they filter out a lot of external noise. All around, the best product I found for the price paid.
Title: They are very good headphones that I use while working out and just ...

Review Contents: Good sound but unless you have the volume very low everyone around you can hear what you are listening to pretty clearly. Blocks out most background noise pretty well if you have the volume turned up.
Title: Kind of disappointing

Review Contents: Cheap, average quality sound, CHEAP. When I first got them, a light but annoying static would continuously play whenever they were turned on. That luckily went away, but that was just the beginning of my struggles with these horrible headphones. The button on the side that controls the headphones is pretty much useless, as holding it down will sometimes turn the headphones on and off and other times just flat out do nothing. Definitely the worst, cheapest made button on an electronic I've ever come across. And even worse, the button popped off after trying to turn my headphones off recently. Don't waste your money.
Title: One Word: Cheap

Title: Great deal for a great headset

Review Contents: Love these headphones.... love them love them love them!!!  Besides the great sound quality and comfort.  I love that you can pair these headphones with two devices at once.  I work on my computer and ipad and most of the time I listen to music from my ipad as a source.  With these I can pause my ipad and switch to a video or audio on my computer just by hitting play.  It does it automatically!
Title: Perfect at a great price.

Review Contents: After wearing it for 30 mins, my ears hurt a lot. It is not very comfortable for long use. The sound quality is good but very painful to use. I'm sending it back.
Title: It is not very comfortable for long use

Review Contents: Works great for my phone, and works well as a headset for my PC.  The mic does not work with Discord, however.  I have tried a few fixes, nothing works.  The battery life seems good and the sound quality seems good to my ears;  they are quite comfortable to wear.
Title: Great for phone, maybe not so great for PC.

Review Contents: I have had these headphones for a while now and have gotten to test them in several different environments (studying, movie watching on my laptop, and even at work when working on a project), and quite frankly I am a little disappointed. The display of them is actually quite stunning - coming with a nice carrying bag and auxiliary cable, however I can only wear them for a maximum of an hour before my ears start hurting and they tend to cut out every so often. There isn't much sound leakage that I've been made aware of, however I haven't necessarily listened to extremely loud music with them. The range on them isn't that good either to be honest.I want very badly to like these as they really do look nice, but with the bluetooth cutting out and the range being so poor, I honestly can't justify using them anymore sadly. I suppose you get what you pay for, and perhaps these are somehow defected and possibly fit others well and do not cause such discomfort, however as it stands I would not recommend these to a friend.**UPDATE 4-11-17**Upon hearing what I had to say Mpow reached out to me and very kindly offered to send me a replacement pair in hopes to have a better user experience. I have tested the new pair some through my daily use and find that the Bluetooth indeed does not cut out as did with my previous pair, however the range still does not seem that great on them and they are quite uncomfortable after about an hour of use, which is not ideal when studying for a long period of time. While I commend Mpow for their amazing customer service, if I could do it again I would most likely have gotten a pair from Avantree instead.**UPDATE 4-24-17**I have had time to use the replacement pair provided to me and while still extremely discomfortable after ~45minutes of use, they have also started going out. From full charge, after a maximum of 2 hours of use, the sound starts cutting in and out and is useless. I am contacting amazon in hopes for a refund and I am ordering a pair of avantree headphones. You get what you pay for and there is a reason these are so cheap. Instead of wasting $36, spend the extra $20 and get a pair that won't be a complete waste.
Title: Waste of money.

Review Contents: Not only does the Mic suck really really bad but it's will sometimes also work only part time. If I can hear things going on than that usually means the mic isn't working. If my mic is working, poorly, then I can't hear anything. I've checked for drivers, controllers, programs, anything that get this thing working full time all the time but nothing. Maybe it's not fully compatible with win10 but I didn't see anything in the description about that. It does feel nice on the head and the ear muffs are really nice and I have a huge head. But then again who cares if they don't work, you won't be wearing them any ways... Update, when listening to music or strickly just for sound only applications they work great. The distance I can go from my laptop is a good √©30 and through walls so that's nice. Or take them out on a nice walk or something they are great. Update: I got another set of headphones and still only get sound part of the time on second life. Anything I try to use that utilizes the mic and headphones at the same time make neither of them work properly. So while sitting there tweaking sound settings and click apply, the sound will come on briefly with a loud click/short noise and then it goes out again. I have tried on win7, win8, and win10. I'm greatful for them reminding me to rewrite this again.

IF it did not pull or grab hair...Maybe ---NOT!*** Update just found out I have to make a special trip to the post office pay for shipping the horrible crap back..Just remember, never wanted to see this  excrement again now its effort. Title: Four Stars

Review Contents: I purchased these headphones primarily for comfort. My usage is usually anywhere between 2 to 8 hours at a time. I‚Äôve owned many headphones and I‚Äôve found that (actual) over-the-ear headphones are the only kind that you can wear for these kinds of extended periods without pain or at least significant discomfort.Simply put, these are NOT over-the-ear headphones. Unless you are a stunted elf-child with unusually dainty ears, these headphones will fit ON-the-ear, not over.When I measured the opening where your ears actually go, rather than the outside of the padding, I found that the space for your ear is actually closer to 42mm wide and 53mm high, or 1.6 inches and 2.08 inches respectively.Even a stunted elf-child would have difficulty fitting his/her ears in such a small opening.I received these on a Saturday and used them with the attached audio cable three separate times, twice for about two (2) hours and once for about four (4). On all occasions I could feel my pulse on my ears after only an hour, and this was after adjusting the headphones to be as loose as possible while still staying in place. Also, on all occasions my ears would hurt after about two (2) hours.I awarded only one (1) star due to the clearly false advertising and discomfort I experienced after wearing them for less than two hours.I have not even paired them yet.Otherwise, the design of these headphones seems sturdy and well constructed. The padding around the ears seems firmly attached and the frame is both flexible and strong, while still being lightweight.I intend to return these and purchase *actual* over-the-ear headphones. Though I might give them one more try as I work tonight, and see if I can‚Äôt ‚Äòfold‚Äô my ear inside and see if they are comfortable ‚Äòenough‚Äô.Sigh.

Review Contents: The only major retail store within 150 miles is Wal-Mart. I have come to depend on Amazon or anything I can't find at Wal-Mart. Shipping a product with a known defect is unacceptable.I wanted headphones for a trip this weekend. There isn't time to replace them before I leave.I can't even return them until I get back because I don't have access to a printer before I leave, and I won't be here on Monday so that I can hand them over to a ups driver.As posted elsewhere, these headphones lose their Bluetooth connection. It doesn't appear to be related to distance or battery charge level. The connection keeps dropping out making them totally useless for Bluetooth listening.They are unable to maintain a connection to a Dish Hopper receiver. Other headphones have been paired to the same box without any problem.I give it a generous 2 star rating because the sound is great for a device in this price category. They can by used with an audio cable, but that doesnt fill my needs.They go back as soon as I get home next week.

Review Contents: I am unfairly comparing these to a much more expensive pair of Bose QC15 headphones which I love, but these Mpows fall short for me in a couple of areas.First off, they are bulkier and heavier than I would like. I have worn my Bose headphones for hours at a time with no problems. But the weight of these and the fact that they clamp a bit tight to my head means that after 30 mins I need to shift them around or take a break. Second, the folding mechanism isn't that helpful. They are still boxy and take up a lot of space in my bag. The way that Bose pivots the ear cups to create more of a flat plane is a better solution for transport in a messenger bag / laptop bag.On the plus side, Mpow bluetooth connectivity is great in my experience. Both these and a separate in-ear set that I have connect quickly and rarely give me issues, and I love the audible notification for power/connect status. Also no complaints about the sound -- volume and clarity are great. I'll stick with Mpow, just not this particular pair.

Review Contents: I got these guys expecting an audiophiles paradise. But trying the headset was anticlimactic. They come with a nice bag case and back up aux cable. The aesthetic and feel of the headset is fantastic. Pairing was easy and the controls are simple. Everything chimes well but the sound. Its standard and it's just fine. But I experienced crisper sharper bass in other models. I have the urge to turn up the vol to feel the bass and clarity, but alas the speakers only go so far. The sound leaks everywhere else but to my ears. Everyone around me can hear them blaring but when I put them on they don't sound like they are blaring at all due to duller sound. But I'm quite a clubbing audiophile and music is my life. For the average normal Joe these will do just fine.

Review Contents: I'm extremely disappointed and dissatisfied with these headphones. I did a TON of research on different *affordable* headphones on Amazon and these seemed to be the best as they have 4.6 stars and over 8,000 reviews. I was poorly mistaken... The advertisement for the headphones says "Designed for an excellent listening experience, Mpow Bluetooth headset with CSR chip and around-ear cushion design can provide robust, immersive and Hi-fidelity sound" which is all 100% true. The headphones provide pretty clear sound and provided enough bass for my liking. However, they also "provide robust, immersive and Hi-fidelity sound" FOR EVERYONE AROUND YOU. I can't listen to anything above a whisper without literally everyone sitting near me also hearing it. The whole point of wearing headphones is so that you can listen to music or podcasts or whatever you want to listen to without disturbing those around you. I bought these for work and they're basically useless to me now because I can't use them without other people also having to listen to whatever I'm playing. I might as well just strap a giant speaker on my head and call it a day.If, for some reason, you enjoy being a nuisance to your coworkers and friends, then these are the headphones for you. They completely surround your ear but are just okay in the comfort department for me. They are noticeably heavy and tight on the top of my head. I wear glasses and they definitely squeeze my frames and shift my glasses.

Review Contents: Succinctly, I really don't like these headphones. I've had them for 15 minutes.I'm a college student and I wanted headphones to walk to class in and to play a really deep bass to help me find my rhythm when I run and to motivate me when I lift weights.They're light and they look cheap. I don't like that. I'd say it's the screws on the outside and the cheap plastic. It's the kind of plastic that looks mid price range when it's nicely polished and no one has touched it but looks like some terrible knockoff when you do touch it (which you will if you want to listen to music) because there are a million fingerprints on it and oil smudges from your skin. I've had these 15 minutes.It's not really comfortable on my ear. I have small ears objectively and the cheap cushion was shaped well but wasn't comfortable. It just outlined my ear shape rather than cushioning it if you know what I mean. But comfort is subjective. I moved them around a lot on my head and just didn't like the feel on my ear. The band adjusts alright though (I have big head by most standards).The music, however. I'm listening to music from Youtube on my laptop so if you were to play it, you'd know exactly the music quality I'm listening to.I listened to Beyonce's Sandcastles on Youtube from my laptop. It was fine. There's really nothing spectacular to me and I have been using the Skullcandy Hesh 2 Wireless for years up until a couple days ago. That's what I am comparing these headphones to. Sounded like loud Beyonce.Then I listened to Life Itself by Glass Animals which has some really interesting staccato drum sounds in its intro. There was no sense of hearing a real drum next to my ear. It was simply the song it always was. Just loud.Next was Trap Check by 2 Chainz. Also on Youtube. The bass sounds muted and a 'far away.' As I turned the music up it didn't help. There wasn't the feeling of hearing different elements of the sound from different locations around your head as I can get with some music. Just louder, everything but the bass which was so strangely muted. The musical change at time 2:37 which usually makes me hype was not only quieter but blurrier so that the complex rhythm just sounded muddled and less impactful.Then! I went to this website written by a professional sound designer to test the ranges of these headphones and find out whether or not it was the Youtube playback or the headphone quality.http://www.audiocheck.net/soundtests_headphones.phpWhen testing the bass Hz to see how low these went, there was only a definitive bass sound at about 45 Hz. Awful for someone who really likes bass.When testing the treble kHz (which was awful and unenjoyable) I found the horrible whining sound was at about 19.5 kHz for me. Great if you really like Meghan Trainor or Taylor Swift.I skipped down to quality testing and found that there was a literal parasitic rattle at the beginning and end of the sweep for 9 seconds at the beginning and 4 at the end. Poor I think.Just generally, they're cheap. I'm going to return them, because I don't like them.
Title: Loves Bass Reviewed Song Quality and Audio Ranges

Review Contents: My nephew uses headphones daily.  He wears them to school, walking home from school, in his room, when he is out--he wears them everywhere.  He can not tolerate the style that are ear buds.  He just doesn't like anything in his ears.  He has gone through SO many headphones, including the famous Beats kind.  I don't know if he is rough on them, or they just die from using them so much, but he has had many kinds.  He had a wired set and the connection was poor, so I got him a cheap BT pair and he liked them.  But then I got him this set, and he LOVED them.  He loved the look right out of the box.  His previous BT pair that he liked was also black and red, but the ear part was much, much thinner.  This whole headset is much larger, but in a good way.  They are light and he says very, very comfortable.  He loves the way they work and they connected to his phone instantly.  He loves that they fold, and liked the carrying case.  It's funny that he actually had told me he did not need or want to try new headphones, until these arrived and he saw them.  His eyes opened wide and he wanted to use them immediately.  He is a teenager, he listens to music all the time and he is no expert on headphones.  But he loves these, and I like him to be happy, so they are a hit for both of us.  The headphones seem to be sturdy, and he hasn't had a problem with them yet so I have high hopes that they are going to last for a while.  When he needs new ones again, I would buy this pair without hesitation.
Title: Big hit with teenage music lover

Review Contents: I was in the market for a Bluetooth headset for chatting with my friends on discord.The headset will connect, but will refuse to be configured. as soon as the windows 7/10 audio management interface opens, the headset remains connected, but loses all audio and feedback. the only solution to this is to turn the headset off and back on again. I can't even adjust the headset's volume due to this predicament. The headset works fine when plugged in with a 3.5mm cable, but that's not what i bought it for.It has to do with the firmware that is applied to this brand of headphones. it's usually applied to lower end bluetooth headsets and is meant for use on your phone. In short, if you want a headset for your PC move on.
Title: If you want a headset for your PC, move on.

Review Contents: Don't trust all these good reviews, they are skewed somehow.I own two of these: model mpbh059ah.1. The manual says you can use 2 simultaneously, after trying for days according to the instructions to make this happen, I called the manufacturer and they said no they cannot, without any explanation of the erroneous manual.2. They are difficult to connect, unless you know all about settings, bluetooth, pairing, sound settings etc.3. When one is connected after a few minutes the tracking starts lagging and becomes out of sync with the picture, so you have to stop the video every 15 min or so and restart to match the sound.4. There is often constant intermittent static or crackling.These were a gift and I wanted to use them to replace a corded earphone splitter that came from amazon but also does not work well, but they are not usable for that purpose.
