Title: Great headphones!

Review Contents: First off, let me say that I bought a pair of Mpow Thors. I got a bad set, or something. They were not satisfactory, so I wrote a 2 star review of the Thors!! Within a week or so, I received an e-mail from the vendor after they read my review. Without me asking, they offered to send me the 059's set of bluetooth headphones, at no charge, as a way of thanking me for being a customer as well as wanting me to be a happy customer. I gladly accepted, and got the 059's a few days later. I must admit, the 059's are more comfortable than the Thor's, as they have an oblong ear pad. I am also happy to report that I have had no phasing of the noise, or the buzzing that were present in the Thor's!!I want to give a big 5 Stars to Mpow's customer service. They recognized a problem WITHOUT me having to call them about it, reached out to me, and replaced the defective product with on that is working fine, and really sounds very good. Overall, I'm really pleased with the sound. Hopefully, I will still be pleased many months from now. I'm also very pleased with a pro-active Customer Service group who doesn't wait to be contacted. Yes, I put up a negative review, and yes the 2 stars is what got their attention. But, they could have just punted on trying to make a customer happy, and they did not!! Kudo's to them for that!I'm giving them  5 stars on this product because of their pro-active customer support. I don't know if the 059's are worth a 5 star review yet. I know they are worth at least 4 stars, based on my listening experience so far. But, the customer service bumps that rating up another star, IMnsHO! That's part of what I pay for. I know things break, and they don't always work correctly! I'm an engineer. I get it. Having someone come to me and say "Hey, we want to make this right" is worth a lot!
Title: Good Headset...GREAT Customer Service!!

Review Contents: I received these headphone after purchasing a different pair of MPOW Bluetooth headphones (MPOW Thor) and being not overly impressed with them.  These headphone are amazing!  The sound quality on these are outstanding and are very affordable.  Those two combined make for an outstanding headset.PROS:+ Lightweight+ Long battery life (about 7-8 hours from my use)+ Comfortable ear pads (they are super soft)+ Bass on the headphones is right where I like it (its not overpowering but it is clearly defined which I like)+ Mids are crystal clear on these headphones.  I have heard some sounds in songs that I have not heard before which is awesome.+ Treble is clear and sounds great.  Guitars, etc, all sound outstanding.CONS:- Tight (The fit is tighter than what I usually like but I also have a big head.)- They will mess up your hair (Not a true con but I am grasping at straws here.)Whether you are listening to metal, rock, pop, or podcasts/audiobooks, these are the headphones for you.  I have had Beats Bluetooth headphones and given the price differences, I would take these over Beats any day.Lastly, I want to talk about MPOW's customer service.  They are amazing.  Honestly, based off just my interactions with their customer service, they are pleasant and easy to do business alone.  I don't have a lot of time to worry about what I buy online and they are just out of this world amazing.If you are looking for headphones that have a great sound and are made by a good company that stands behind their product, look no further.  You found the headphones you were looking for.
Title: What is there not to like?!

Review Contents: I bought these headphones during "Prime Day" recently. I think they were slightly discounted. My main goal for these was to talk on my cell phone without having to hold the phone up to my ear. I am hearing impaired and many headphones just don't cut it for me as far as clarity and loudness. I hoped that this Mpow pair would.I liked that they could be used with Bluetooth but also corded. They are foldable and comfortable on my ears and they fit when I am wearing my hearing aids and when I am not. They paired almost instantly with my phone and computer and they sounded really good - when listening to music. However, when I listened to voices on the phone, they were muffled and I couldn't understand a lot of what was being said. That is not to say that these are bad headphones. They aren't. My ears are bad and only a choice few are clear and loud enough for me to use with voice calls. These, unfortunately were not. I was going to keep them for music and even watching videos online because the clarity for those activities was good. I decided though that I needed to keep looking for some Bluetooth headphones that served my original purpose so I did return these. I am still going with 4 stars because they were crisp and clear as well as comfortable when listening to online music and videos. My sons said they sounded plenty loud enough for their good ears when listening to voices on the phone. They did say though that some callers on the other end said that they sounded somewhat muffled or tinny.In all, these are good low priced headphones with the versatility of Bluetooth or corded use. They sound pretty good and feel good. They're foldable and easy to carry with you. They pair easily and they are easy to use as far as the commands. They just didn't work out for me. The only thing that was a con for my sons with normal hearing (besides them not having high end booming bass) was that callers said their voices were a little muffled or a bit distorted. Not enough to keep the caller from understanding them though. They are worth the cost if you want a decent pair of headphones that can be used two ways and that have good sound for the low price.
Title: Lots of pros but I had to return these.

Review Contents: :( i had these headphones in my wish list and I was SO excited when I received these as a gift for Christmas! I love them.. they‚Äôre comfortable (I‚Äôm reading reviews about it being too snug on your head. I kind of agree, even with the cushion on the band.. but I think it‚Äôs just because the ear pieces are bigger and maybe a bit heavy, so it sits a little heavy, maybe. It doesn‚Äôt bother me too much so it‚Äôs not a complaint for me.) I‚Äôm reading other reviews about poor quality/sound, like the sound goes out or is too low or scratchy. I have not experienced anything like that.... my sound is great! It really is clear sound. I actually bought a Bluetooth converter and hooked it up to my TV so I can listen to my shows through my headphones. I love it! One very unfortunate thing..after about 5 minutes of listening, I start to hear a *very* high pitched sound. Non stop, long continuous high pitched beeping in my ear. :( the only time it stops is if I pause or fast fwd/rewind the tv. Because they were a gift for Christmas, I don‚Äôt know if I can return them. I‚Äôd like to try another pair but would rather not buy them myself since they were a gift.
Title: LOVE the headphones! High pitched beeping gives me a headache :(

Review Contents: I purchased these in July. I use them on a daily basis. Let me start with the pros and cons:Pros:battery life is approx. 7-10 hours of use even when I accidentally leave them on all night. I've had them off the charger for nearly 3 days at one pointfairly lightweight for the sizevery nice lookingcontrols are pretty easy to navigatesound is about 7.5 or 8 out of 10connects very easilyCons:gets hot on your ears in about 15-20 minutesthey are very stiff to open up when trying to take them offcustomer service is not getting back to me about a warranty replacementthe side broke because of the constant taking off - due to the non-flexible arms that won't give outwarddifficult to turn off at timesI loved them until the arm broke and then getting ignored. I'm really disappointed because it can be an outstanding unit, The sound is beyond a unit at this price, battery life is more than sufficient and the option of using the cord in an emergency is great. What good is if if they won't get back to you when they break. I'd give then 3-4 stars if they just got back to me. 4.5 if they replaced them or fixed them. Overall, 2 is sufficient for a 5 month old dead headphone unit.
Title: Great start for BT cans, but dead in the water at 5 months and no return emails from the company for days and days

Review Contents: Full Transparency: I was sent a free pair of these after I gave a poor review of another set of Mpow headsets.First of all, I was initially was going to buy these headphones. The were touted as the best selling on Amazon - woo hoo. But the initial product description said there was an "updated version" of these headsets so I bought those instead - and was very unhappy with them. I contemplated sending them back but the loss in shipping made me wanted to just to eat the cost of the set. But Mpow contacted me and sent me these in hopes that I'd be more satisfied.Originally purchased these: Please see my review.Mpow Thor Bluetooth Headphones On Ear, 40mm Driver Wireless Headset Foldable with Mic, Wired and Wireless Headphones for Cell Phone/ TV/ PCNow onto this review;First of all, the build is better. The ear pads actually cover the ear completely and comfortably. They didn't crush my head.The unit "speaks" as you're turning the device on, pairing, turning off and other functions. Bluetooth was fast to pair on my Samsung android phone.As for sound: My complaint on the first set I had was it sounded thin, had no low end and I had to eq the heck out of them to make them sound halfway acceptable. These are the exact opposite. If you like super heavy, congested, compressed bass - these headsets are for you. I can't seem to find an eq setting to make them sound acceptable to me. I shouldn't have to dramatically adjust my eq to get things sounding good. My Sennheiser HD202's (which are no longer available, and didn't cost much more than these) sound 100x better with a flat EQ. They sound open and honest.I am happy with Mpow's customer service and willingness to make me happy. Unfortunately, I don't think these are for me and cannot recommend them.
Title: I have to pass - you should too.

Review Contents: I've had two sets of these for some time now.  The sound is remarkably clear and well balanced for such a cheap set.  These also have really good noise isolation and allow me to watch video on my phone while other people are making a lot of noise in the same room.  I was also pretty impressed with the build quality.  The expansion parts of the band are made of metal and also slide into a metal guide.  After owning so many cheap headsets, I can tell you this is the place they normally break and these are built to last.  The only problem I have with these is that cosmetic plastic on the outside.  This hasn't been an issue for the pair my daughters use but on the pair I use the plastic has started cracking all over.  I assume this is due to my larger head and the plastic just not being able to flex well.  They would've done better to wrap the middle portion in a nice p-leather wrap that flexed over people's heads.  All-in-all a very good value.  I would definitely get these if you are looking for kids or, perhaps, women.  Dudes with big heads, this is still a good value that will last but you will likely get some cosmetic damage from regular use.
Title: Good value.

Review Contents: Pros:‚Ä¢ Very comfortable fit. I feel like I could wear them for hours without even noticing them.‚Ä¢ Sound quality is great for the price! Nothing to complain about.Cons:‚Ä¢ THE SOUND BLEEDS/LEAKS SO BAD. Basically unwearable. I can only ever wear them in my home because if I were to wear them anywhere where other humans would be I think they'd murder me. It's basically like you're not wearing headphones at all.I am heartbroken because I love these headphones. They work fine and are comfortable, but I just can't use them.I would NOT recommend them to ANYONE unless you are only going to be using them in places where bleeding noise isn't an issue - which is basically nowhere. I have NO idea how there are SO MANY good reviews for this product. Could it be possible that I received a defective product?? I hope so because otherwise all of these people are blaring music out loud and don't know it.
Title: NOISE BLEEDS - WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

Review Contents: These are impressive for the price. Unlike the cheaper Mpows, the sound from these compare favorably with what I consider the gold standard for inexpensive over-ear headphones, the Sennheiser HD 202. The 202s have a slight edge in overall presence and clarity, but you have to really listen to them closely back-to-back to hear it. In everyday use (on the bus, for example), I have zero complaints about the sound quality while listening to music, podcasts, and TV shows.The primary downside to these is weight and fit‚Äîthey're significantly heavier than the Mpow Thors, and I have to fiddle with the placement on my head so the back of my ears don't start to hurt after an hour or so of listening. I think I've got the placement right, but they're definitely not the most comfortable headphones I own. (This is an area where, obviously, every head is different, so if they fit you perfectly, you win.)Other notes:- When paired with my phone (LG G4), the sound is very bass-heavy with the phone volume all the way up and the headphone volume in the middle. It balances out with the phone volume around 50-60% and the headphone's volume one beep away from the top. (Again, YMMV, but if the sound isn't exactly to your liking, mess with your various volume options. The bass-treble balance when plugged in seems fine at all volume levels.)- Multipoint Bluetooth is a nice touch. Can go between laptop and phone without repairing.- The status LED blinks when it's connected. It's not noticeable outside, but in, say, a dark bedroom next to a sleeping spouse, this could be a problem. I either flip them around so the light faces away, or connect via a cable with the headphones powered off.- Yeah, they're kinda ugly. But the build quality seems very solid, especially considering the price.- They're not noise cancelling, but the earpads are substantial enough (and fit tight enough) to block out lots of outside noise. I have to take them off to hear other people talking to me.- I don't know how long the battery lasts, because I've never been able to run it down completely. I'm going to guess this is why they weigh so much. These run for a long time.(Disclosure: I received these from Patozon after posting a negative review of the Mpow Thor headphones. Kudos to their customer service team for reaching out and taking care of unhappy customers. As you can tell from my other review, if this was a crap product, I'd write that here.)
Title: Impressive sound if they fit you

Review Contents: Unlike most of my Amazon purchases, I didn't spend a ton of time researching these babies - maybe an hour or so. I wanted to make sure I had a solid pair of headphones before a sudden bout of traveling, so I needed to research and buy pretty quickly. Despite the purchase feeling a bit rushed, overall I'm pretty satisfied with them.Pros: They feel hefty and of good construction, especially for the low price point. Bluetooth pairing was super easy. I'm no audiophile, but sound quality is plenty good for me. I haven't tested the longevity of the battery yet, but it's totally suitable for my needs (mostly when I'm on airplanes and out running). They're not designed for exercise, but I wear them when I go jogging, and so far they work great: no slipping off my head.Cons: Ear cups are comfy, but not terribly breathable, and my ears get a little warm after an hour or so. They're just a smidge bulkier than I'd like. Color isn't my taste, but whatevs. No active noise cancellation.Actually, that last item is my biggest gripe: at the time of my purchase, the headline and item description was just a little slimy. The seller didn't exactly promise *active* noise cancellation, but they were sure to point out "noise-cancelling" as a feature several times. Given the price point, I sort of expected that this was all just mildly deceitful marketing for keyword purposes, and by "noise-cancelling" they actually just meant "over-ear." I decided to pull the trigger and order these guys anyway, but I decided I'd be pleasantly surprised if there actually was active noise cancellation on these things.I wasn't surprised. No noise-cancelling technology. I notice that the headline and item description has since been updated to be much more honest about that, and kudos to the seller for being more upfront. I wish things had been a bit more honest when I decided to buy them, but I'm not too disappointed. For the price point, these things are totally serviceable. No regrets.
Title: Totally Acceptable and Completely Harmless Wireless Over-Ear Headphones

Review Contents: I received these Bluetooth headphones for Christmas after putting them on my Amazon wishlist. I got the green and they're incredible. I have 4 different devices I connect these to. A Samsung smart tv, A Samsung Galaxy Note 4 phone, A Samsung galaxy tab 4, and an iPod Touch Gen 5. These paired up super easy and fast to all my devices. I love listening to my tv through them late at night without disturbing anyone else. I've used them for hours at a time and they just keep going. The ear part is extremely soft leather feeling material and are super comfortable. The only tiny con, is they are pretty big and heavy. I lay in bed on my back and listen to them so it's not usually an issue. I can also get up and go to other rooms and they stay connected. I highly recommend them. They work flawlessly for me!
Title: Best Headphones ever!

Review Contents: I wear these every day. They're comfortable, really sound isolating (I wear them on busy city streets and on public transportation daily), and fit a wide range of head sizes. I've had them about 6 months and they're holding up to heavy use.The battery life on these is fantastic - regularly 12 hours or more of use between charges. On the rare occasion my battery runs out the AUX cable backup works very well, and works with any standard AUX cable in case you lose the original.They do occasionally experience interference, moreso that some more expensive bluetooth headphones I have had. I get static "zaps" occasionally that are really uncomfortable, but they're not frequent enough for me to look for a new pair of headphones.
Title: Mostly great, with occasional interference problems.

Review Contents: Just got this today and I decided I would buy a second one for my girlfriend in pink, that's how nice these are. If you're like me and you're not an audiophile but you enjoy tech this is a great low price option for headphones. Sound quality isn't amazing but it's way better than the price would suggest. The bass could be a little better, very weak in that area. Connectivity is great and the ability to connect two things is awesome, I connected my phone and my laptop and can switch between them easily. The quality of materials is where this really blows me away, this seems to be built with high quality materials. Call quality is adequate, not the best I've seen. Any negative is easily balanced out by what a great price these are.
Title: Quality

Review Contents: Honestly these perform much better than I expected. Great quality for the cost. Decent sound, very comfortable. I have weirdly shaped ears so it's always a huge pain to find ear buds that fit and around-the-ear headphones that don't sit on the tops of my ears and pinch them. These are taller than they are wide and do not do that. These I can sit in for hours. They are too warm to work out in, but I have had no issues pairing them with either a Windows 10 computer using a universal bluetooth dongle, or my Google Pixel phone. They only took a couple hours to charge via 3.0 usb to my computer at work the first time I had to charge them. I've had them about 2 weeks and used them a dozen times. Literally my only complaint is that a light flashes on the side while they're paired, which is distracting if you're in the dark.
Title: Great Bang/$$

Review Contents: Arrived within 24 hrs which was awesome. Ok so here's the skinny:Pros:-GREAT price. Product is totally worth the small amount for Bluetooth headphones.-Sound quality is 4/5 stars for me. It's pretty clear and crisp, the only thing that's a shame is you can't customize the sound. There is a small hum when there is no audio connected but it's no biggie it goes away as soon as you start playing something.-The controls are simple and work great. The playback button works with Youtube, mp3 player, media players, etc. VERY impressive.-The looks are cool. The whole black/red combo looks slick.-Comfortable. They feel great and the weight is distributed very evenly. So you can wear them for an extended amount of time.-OVER THE EAR FIT. I have big/ thick ears. So a lot of over the ear headphones don't really work for me. I usually have to bend my ears to get them to fit and it limits the time I can wear them. These fit GREAT. So all you folks worried about it not fitting over your ear, rest easy. These will fit over your ears just fine.Cons:-The only thing I can think of is the limits in volume. Don't get me wrong it gets loud, but I kinda like listening to the point of going deaf. This is more of a personal preference thing though.
Title: Great buy. Read on for details.

Review Contents: Its not good
Title: One Star

Review Contents: I bought the pink version and I love it and it gets the job done! I have Bose headphones and was looking for a cord free version that was budget friendly.Look:The pink is opaque and has an ever so slight shimmer when the light hits at a certain angle but it is not a shimmery/pearlescent product by any means. When worn, these look fairly large over the head but that doesn't bother me. Hopefully this will deter people from talking to me as I wear them.Feel:These headphones have a good weight to them and feel sturdy, even at the bend where they fold in half. They fold easily without resistance for easy transportation. They are over the ear and feel comfortable after long hours of wear. The cushions are very soft. Not so comfortable when you wear them in bed, laying down, as you watch Netflix as your BF is sleeping next to you but it still does the job.It comes with a microfiber/velvet (?) pouch. Very soft on the outside and will help carry these for now unless you want to get a hard case for them.Function:Press once to turn on (will flash blue). Press again (and hold) to pair (will flash blue and red). Press and hold to disconnect. And press and hold to turn off. All modes will have a voice that comes on and tells you if you're connected, pairing or turning off.Without reading the instructions it was very easy and seamless to pair with my Bluetooth items like my cellphone and iPad. It comes up as Mpow 059. Sound is clear. You can turn up/down the volume on the headphone itself or on your Bluetooth device. Fast forward, back, pause, play all work seamless with your Bluetooth device.This also comes with a wire in case your charge dies. So it can be used wired or wireless.Charging:I believe there is some amount of charge when you get this. Not sure how much but you can use it for a while. Comes with a (very short) USB charging cord. I used my iPhone charging unit, plugged it in and a it charges. A red light comes on when charging and no light when it's fully charged.I am not sure how long it takes to charge as I plug it in overnight.Sound:I am not an audiophile and I haven't tried Beats or other expensive high tech headphone products. My main concerns were cord free/Bluetooth and budget friendly. This hits everything I want. Clear audio, no scratchy sounds. Goes about 30 ft or so before connection skips. Very pleased with being able to listen to my devices and walk into another room without interruption.Making a phone call:I've only done this once and it works. The caller could clearly hear me and I could hear them, clear but they sounded distant. I've only made a call once so I can't speak extensively other than it does work and you can hear and be heardOverall very very pleased with this product. The pink colour is so cute, feels sturdy, sound is clear and I love that it's cord free. No more forgetting about the wire and getting it snagged on something as you're walking around! A great buy!Additionally I ordered this on a random Tues night at 11pm and got it the next morning, even though I was expecting a Friday delivery!Enjoy the pictures, there's not enough of the pink version, so hope these are helpful for anyone contemplating the pink ones.
Title: Cord free and budget friendly!

Review Contents: I originally bought the Mpow on-the-ear 40-mm driver bluetooth headphones. They did not fit me well and put a lot of pressure on my ears because there was no front-to-back swiveling of the earcups. The company responded to my less than enthusiastic review and sent me these to try out. These are larger headphones (so less packable) but since I don't travel with large headphones that isn't a concern for me. Comfort and sound quality are my top priorities. These fit over my ears nicely and have just enough front-to-back swivel that they adjust to fit my head well. The smallest adjustment might still be a little bit large for kids or adults with small heads, but they should fit most people nicely. I haven't tried out the microphone yet for bluetooth phone calls, but the sound quality is good. All in all, these fit well, provide nice sound, and are an excellent value at their price point.
Title: Comfortable fit, great value!

Review Contents: The build quality of these Mpows feels very good.  The materials feel like they are quality.  The ear pads are soft and feel good on your head.  The ear holes are large enough to go over your entire ear (I've used other over er head phones that haven't been large enough).  The headband is thick and feel sturdy.  It doesn't feel like something that would break easily.There are only two complaints that I would have about these headphones.  The buttons (play/pause, volume, forward, back) all kind of blend together.  When I'm feeling around for the play/pause button I can't tell the difference between where that button ends and the outer ring of buttons begins.  I've used other headphones where these buttons have a ridge between them so you know where one ends and the other begins.  Maybe I'll get more used to it over time.  Finally, the bass is decent, but I've used other headphones for the same price that had better bass.  I used a couple pairs side by side and the Mpows definitely had less bass than the other pair.Overall I really enjoy the fit and feel of the Mpows.  I wish it was easier to distinguish the buttons on the ear, and the bass could be a bit better.  I still like the headphones and plan to keep them.
Title: Good build quality, sound quality is decent.

Review Contents: I received an email from the seller after leaving a review for the MPOW Thor.  I was very disappointed with the quality of them. They offered to send me a pair of the 059 as a replacement. I have tried several of the more popular brands in this price range including MPOW, Advantree, Ausdom, and a few others.The quality of these headphones is day and night in comparison to the Thor.+The sound quality is probably one of the better ones in this price range.+Pairing is simple, I was able to pair to my Note 8 and PC without any issues.+The weight of the headphones are light and have been able to wear them for over 4 hours.+The padding at the top of the headphone is very soft adding to the length of time I can wear.+ Battery life has lasted well over 6 hours so far.+Everything fits nicely into the carry puch-The sound does seem to leak and those around me reported they can easily hear the music.I have yet to see how long the plastic will last. I also have not used them to send/receive any calls.
Title: Good quality headset for the price.

Review Contents: I have used this item for the last three weeks, and I am well pleased with it.  Headset is light and comfortable enough to listen to an entire  College football game without neck fatigue or sore ears.  Wireless connections are easily made, and are stable.  Range of Bluetooth connection is well over 30 feet, and covers the interior volume of my house.  Acoustic performance is excellent, crisp high tones and full bodied low tones.  My current wired headphones are an updated version of the classic Koss Pro 4 AA Titanium.  The performance of this inexpensive set is admirable, and does not fall short of the standard of my best wired set.  I am glad I purchased this item, truly the most bang for the buck..
Title: Lots of Bang for Your Buck

Review Contents: These headphones fit comfortably over my small ears and work great, for about 30 minutes, after which time they lose connection and do not reconnect. I've contacted the seller to return them but have not heard back. They only work if I plug them in, which defeats the purpose of paying for Bluetooth headphones. Those with larger ears will not find these headphones comfortable.
Title: Comfortable fit but don't stay connected.

Review Contents: Love them.  Great headphones at an affordable price . Comfortable and they help to block out some ambient sounds immediately just by putting them on without your own input. Once music or voice recordings are played the quality of the sounds are very good. I use these for my own enjoyment to be able to hear my own selections over TV and overhead speaker sounds. I am not a professional so these headphones  work perfectly for my needs. I would recommend them and would purchase them again as gifts. I have not used the blue tooth capability yet, however, it is nice to have if I ever need it.
Title: Very satisfied with these headphones.

Review Contents: First off their support is awesome.  I bought a different pair which said over the ear, but they were not and the company sent me these at no charge.  I wear glasses and have the issue where if the ear pads press on my ears it then presses on the arm of my glasses which is causes discomfort.  These do not.They fit over my whole ear and I was able to wear them for a good part of the day.  There is only a very slight comfort issue after about 4-5 hours of continuous wearing them with my glasses.  The padding and headphones are stiff so I'm assuming if your head is on the larger size of standard then these may feel tighter.Sound quality... I'm no audiophite so it plays the music which comes out of my computer just fine and sounds great to me.
Title: Wear Glasses, these are for you.

Review Contents: I bought these as a gift, and shortly bought a pair of them based on the great feedback. For $35 you get a fantasticset of headphones. I use them at work almost daily. So far they have great battery life, great balanced sound, and quite comfortable.I wish I would have known there was a newer version, but I'm very happy with these as is.The question will be how they hold up over time. That's always the next question regarding a initially great yet cheap product.Very few products follow the general rule of quality versus price but thus far this one is.
Title: Amazing product for the money.

Review Contents: I got these for my wife because she really likes my Beats Studio headphones, but didn‚Äôt want the expense and worry that she would break them.  So I got her these and she‚Äôs a fan.Originally I had loaned her my Powerbeats to use while flying but they hurt her ears and she could still hear a lot of engine noise.  These MPows though took care of that.  We haven‚Äôt tested the limits of the battery but they last for more than 5hrs easily.Only gripe is in wish it came with a shell/case rather than a cloth pull-tie bag.  Other than that, great headphones.
Title: Great for Planes

Review Contents: I received these as a gift for Father's day from my wishlist and have been using them for about one week. I Have to say they have exceeded my expectations. right out of the box I could tell these are going to last a while. Not only do they look really clean and modern. The sound quality is crisp and clean. The ear muff material is nice and soft I just wish they were bigger for my huge ears, but this is not a con. At the joint where they extend there is a metal joint that looks very sturdy. I'd be really surprised if they ever broke. They are easy to connect and power off and the microphone works well on phone calls. I have not tried the wired connection.  For this price range, I don't think these can be beat.
Title: Great Value head phones

Review Contents: I am so happy with these headphones. I like the voice prompts (turning on, off, connect and disconnect) BUT the voice prompt is pretty loud so do all the connecting and disconnecting with them off your ears. The package included a warning to only charge with a 5V charger -- but 5 volt adapters deliver different amps. I asked the company and they confirmed these  adapters are safe -- all are. Beware the iPad usb adapters (the square ones) are 5.1 or 5.2 volts, so don't use them. computer usb port: 5v 0.5 amps/2.5 watts  iPhone: 5v 1.0 amps/5 wattsAnker PowerPort 4: 5v 2.0 amps/10 watts
Title: comfortable, easy to use, excellent purchase, volts/amps charging info

Review Contents: These are a nice pair of headphones that I bought on a whim. Part of me wishes I should've thought through it a bit more, but literally I was looking for a decent pair of headphones so I went on Amazon, searched headphones and filtered by top ratings, and the Mpow was one of them. With over 9,000 reviews, I bought them. I bought the green ones (my fav color) and had them for about 6 months now. Here are some of my thoughts on this gear:- For the price of the headphones, sound quality is above average. The bass is good, but the highs and mids are quite suppressed, but if you are just a regular music listener that's not picky about sound, you probably couldn't even tell. If you mainly listen to bass-y music, these are fine esp if you're under a tight budget. You will miss the vibrant full sound however, but then again, you probably couldn't tell if you aren't an audiophile.- These headphones are heavy. I noticed as I use them to listen to music at work. After about an hour of listening, the top of your head begins to slightly hurt due to the weight of the headphones. These aren't the lightest (quite bulky actually) and might be a bit uncomfortable carrying these around for travels. It does come with a pouch for storage and the headphones are foldable.- I've had these for 6 months and use them about 3x per week, and so far, no wear or tear. Very durable product. I don't foresee it breaking down any time soon.- If you are trying to purchase these for heavy bluetooth usage, I would advise not to purchase these. I think the bluetooth is weak on these. I tried pairing it with my PC and my IPhone, and indeed the connection is there, but the quality of sound was lacking.Overall, would I purchase these again? No, I wouldn't because I enjoy high quality sound and this interest of mine is something that I got into recently. Not saying these Mpows have terrible sound. These are actually pretty great for the price of it. But now, I rather pay more for better build and sound. These are my first headphones I've purchased, and I use it as a baseline to other audio gear purchases.
Title: These are a nice pair of headphones that I bought on a whim

Review Contents: I have owned a number of different Bluetooth audio device from mpow and I've always been fairly happy with my purchase. This headphone is no exception! I compared the sound quality to my corded Samsung play on headphones and I actually thought these sounded better! You can tell the build quality isn't as great as the Samsung or a pair of Bose headphones but these are a fraction of the cost of those 2. As other reviewers have mentioned, if you wear these headphones more more than an hour or two at a time, it gets a little uncomfortable on the ears. That being said, it does provide a little bit of sound blocking which helps a little bit on airplanes but doesn't compare to the qc line from Bose if that's what you're looking for.At this price point, this product cannot be beat!
Title: Great pair of BT headphones for $30!

Review Contents: I just got these today... the sound is amazing.  I've had 3 pairs of Beats they all broke on the band that goes over the head.. snapped and exposed the wires.  I was sick of spending a lot of money and decided to try something less expensive and I'm glad that I did because the sound is very comparable.  I'm only listening to music on my PC but the quality is really sound is nice I haven't paired it with my TV or phone yet.  I gave it 4 stars because I'm still evaluating them.. but will update in a few weeks.  Love them so far!!!!
Title: the sound is amazing. I've had 3 pairs of Beats they all ...

Review Contents: I rarely leave bad reviews. But it is just so extremely depressing how tens of thousands of people have bought these Mpow's on Amazon and are forced to listen to these horrible sounding pieces of crap on a daily basis.  So call me whiney but through trial, error, and experience I have come to the conclusion you might  have to spend around $50 for great sounding over the ear headphones with cords,  And also think you might need to spend $100 if you want wireless Bluetooth headphones that sound great.
Title: Versatile! but they sound similar to $10 generic earbuds.

Review Contents: Good deal for the money, wife bought Beats for 8x the cost, sounds similar. Design is not as clean as the Beats but I'm happy. I also them with my Xbox one controller with the included aux cord. FYI no microphone.
Title: Good deal for the money.

Review Contents: A friend at school suggested these because he had just purchased a set and was very pleased. So I ordered a pair for my husband for Christmas.  He loves them! üòçPros:‚Ä¢Wireless with quality sound:(1) He is constantly walking around the house talking on the phone while he does other things . . . Not complaining sometimes the dishes get done üòÅ(2) he says the sound is really clear and the people he talks to so not have a problem hearing him.‚Ä¢dual connection to devices: He connects to both his phone and a wireless speaker.‚Ä¢comfort: he says they are comfortable. The  padding could be more plush but even when he wears them for a extended period of time they are not painful. He would be happier if it had a litle more padding round the top; however, he is balled.‚Ä¢convenience: (1) they collapse and can go into a carry pouch that is provided. (2) they have control setting buttons on the headset: volume fastforward/rewind, connectivity buy-in, phone answer button‚Ä¢warranty: 4 year. $4 (&some change)
Title: Great quality deal for the price!

Review Contents: I have had these for a few weeks now and absolutely love them. While they are not Bose sound quality, they are great for almost everything I listen to. I love the Bluetooth and it works great but the option to have a cord for things like the PS4 and others is perfect. (I have a spare cord that has a mic built-in so I can use these for online gaming no problem.My wife and I use these for watching TV and Movies late at night now in tandem with another set of speakers that I can passthrough audio.
Title: Excellent budget over-the-ear headphones! Great quality!

Review Contents: My wife bought me these for my birthday this week after my ear buds have been giving me ear issues. I love the feel of them sitting over my ear completely. Linking the Bluetooth was very easy and I'm happy they came with an audio cable to connect at work for long days of listening.The only gripe I have (and it looks like I'm not alone) is the microphone is horrible. I tried to call my wife to test it out and she couldn't hear me at all. I don't see myself using them with my phone all that often, but I would say that needs work for future sets. Listening to Spotify or iTunes has really good sound quality! I look forward to using them on flights to see how they do.
Title: Great sound, bad mic

Review Contents: When I initially paired to my Mac and tried listening to Spotify it sounded like I was in a tunnel - very poor sound quality.  Since I have an older Mac I thought maybe it was the version of Bluetooth causing the poor quality, so I paired it with my OnePlus 3T (Android smartphone).  That's when the issues started.  Pairing to 2 devices was troublesome from start to finish.  The directions weren't accurate, and when I finally got them both paired the signal from my phone never worked as I was playing Spotify to check connection quality on each device.  Once I disconnected my Mac the signal quality from my phone was much better quality and much closer to other reviews here, though not outstanding.  Feeling frustrated and ready to send them back, I did a quick mic test as I bought these to be multipurpose headphones.  The results?  The person on the other end heard faint static and a whistle every time I spoke - not cool.  So why not a 1 star?  The sound quality from my phone (when only paired to 1 device) was worth a star.
Title: Does not work properly when paired with 2 devices

Review Contents: I got these as a gift from my boyfriend for my birthday in November. As of January, the right headphone is significantly quieter than the left. It hasn‚Äôt been bothering me much because I can use the equalizer on my laptop to balance it, but I can‚Äôt always do that on my phone so I don‚Äôt really use them anymore. Pretty disappointing. However, I did enjoy the sound quality when it did work properly and how fast it was to connect to my multiple devices. I choose 2 stars because of how quickly (Nov - Jan ~ 3 months) they crapped out on me.
Title: Right headphone significantly quieter than the left after 3 months of continuous usage.

Review Contents: The mic works very strangely. I bought these to play music but was excited that they also had mic capability. You CAN use them to play music and play games with people but they have two "modes". They have the headset and the headphone modes. You have to set your sound settings to use the headset as default for communications AND as your default sound to be able to do both at the same time. The sound quality gets worse though, for some reason. Maybe I'm doing something wrong, but for the life of me I can't get my skype to use the regular headphone setting over the headset setting.As regular wireless headphones though? Pretty darn good. Love that they have wireless and wired mode. Great sound quality for what you pay for. They have a pretty decent battery life and I really like that they fold up. Perfect for anyone with public commutes in the morning.
Title: Solid wireless headphones, sub-par headset

Review Contents: These are no doubt the best Bluetooth wireless headphones in the sub $100.00 category period! I would dare to say they even rival many headphones in the $100.00+ range. The sound is that of higher-end Sony or Beats by Dre' headphones.  The passive noise cancellation works well for being passive, and since it's using passive noise cancellation the battery life is fantastic. You simply cannot buy a better wireless headphone at this price point!  I can't speak to the longevity of the headphones yet, but if the quality is anything like what they put inside of the headphones, I don't think there is anything to worry about. I loved them so much, I am buying a second pair.
Title: Mpow Delivers!  The specs at this price point are amazing!

Review Contents: I picked up the Mpow 059 Bluetooth headset about 6 weeks ago. I use them every single night. They are high quality, sound great, and you could buy how many pairs of these for the price of one pair of Bose? Yea, I know these do not have any type of active noise cancelation. Well if you must have that feature then these are not for you. Mpow makes some ANC headphones. I‚Äôll have to check those out next. Major Go here!.
Title: METALJEW: Major Go! Mpow = Tremendous Value

Review Contents: Three things you need to know before buying:Very good headphones when using them with your phone. However, when I use them with my laptop, they manage to lag and miss the beat of whatever I'm listening to, wether its videos on youtube or my friends' voices when on skype. There are a couple videos on youtube to stop it from doing things like totally collapsing when getting a skype call, which happens due to the fact that these can be used for phone calls, but besides that, it still lags from now and then.The battery life is acceptable. I would go ahead and say its actually very good, but since I'm a heavy user, it runs out in just a couple days, so it depends on your usage of it. No problems when charging them thought, they do it in four hours, which is also acceptable.Now, I said these can be used for phonecalls, but don't, since their microphone is terrible, and I mean, appallingly bad. In a room where you are alone, trying to call your family, they are good, any other less ideal place is a horrible choice, especially if you are calling someone who knows what good quality sounds like; I called my mom using them and, since she is not too demanding on these regards, she was happy with just being able to listen to me. Let me add, if you have a laptop and use skype, you can chance the settings so you can use your laptop's microphone instead of your headphones'. If you have a desktop, sorry then, because you'll have your listeners abhorred.Ok, I just told you everything wrong/kind of messy with these, all other aspect of it is great. Good sound quality, practicality, portability, etc. Totally worth the price. Don't go in for a top notch feel, bacause it's less than forty dollars; go in however for a big, fat smile for the bargain you are getting with these.Cheers
Title: Great Headphones, but do read my three preoccupations

Review Contents: For me, price good, wireless connect good, I play a computer game for few hours and have no any problem with the battery. The reason I can't give the product 5 stars because:  * I think the sound lower than I expect even I set the volume to max.  * It's hurt my ear when I use for a long time, about 2 hours and more.  * I can't hear the bass, low note and high note very clear.Anyway, to compare with other product from Beat or Bose, the price is acceptable and good quality. After 2 weeks I use it, I think it ok and recommend buy it if you don't ready spend more than $100 for something you think better.
Title: price good, wireless connect good

Review Contents: I got these headphones for my open work environment.  I didn't want to pay a lot, but I wanted comfortable headphones with a few nice features.  These headphones met all of my expectations and then some.Pros----- Great range of sound (bass and treble stand out)- Bluetooth features are easy to use and convenient- Built-in mic works well with my phone- Battery life is really good (I haven't experienced a dead battery and I only occationally charge them)- Single unforked 3.5mm audio cable is convenient, though I've hardly used it- Nice physical design (folds well, over-the-ear comfort, nice storage pouch)- Great price!Cons----- Audio quality is better than I expected for the price, but it may not be adequate for highly critical ears- No noise cancellation; surrounding noise isn't very audible, but surrounding people can hear loud audio at ~5ft.- Comfort is average; not the most comfortable, but not uncomfortable
Title: Great Headphones at a Low Price

Review Contents: These headphones are fine except for what I will describe in bluetooth mode. The headphones tend to disconnect when I am not using them for a while. That is fine and understandable. But it's the reconnecting them part that irritates me to death. First, I have to push the power button for about 15-20 seconds. Then a voice says "headset disconnected". Then I push the power button for another 15-20 seconds and a voice says "Powering off". Then I have to push the power button again for 15-20 seconds and the voice says "Phone one connected". So you see, I wind up spending 45-60 minutes getting them activated every time I want to use them. That is simply too frustrating, especially since each phase is so time consuming. How about a simple on/off switch?
Title: These headphones are fine except for what I will describe in bluetooth mode

Review Contents: After almost half a year of use, these headphones are great options if you are looking to buy something on a budget (At the time of purchase these were only about $30.00). These sound great compared to products at a similar price and the mic works very well. While these may be bluetooth, they come with an audio cable that allows you to listen even if the headphones are dead. The adjustable band allows it to fit snug around your head but it seems bulky, making it difficult for me to wear a hood while wearing these.Although a minor complaint, the biggest problem that I have is the fact that you can't use the mic or buttons if you were just using the audio cable. It would be nice if it came with an inline remote and mic on the cable but besides that, I haven't had any problems with these headphones and I use them on a regular basis.
Title: these headphones are great options if you are looking to buy something on ...

Review Contents: Not what I was expecting, and I'm returning this item less than 3 hours after receiving it. It would get one star, except I will acknowledge that the passive noise cancellation is pretty effective. The downside? Everyone else can hear literally everything that you're listening to, even on very low volume. This set of headphones is more like strapping two speakers to the side of your head... plus some noise cancellation benefits. Result? You can use them, but be prepared to annoy everyone working next to you, sitting next to you, or anywhere near you. It's odd because a friend's pair didn't seem to have this problem. Chalk it up to inconsistent design implementation/ quality. In summary, you're gambling with your time and money. I'm gonna fork over more cash for something better next time.
Title: Noise cancelling is ok... but everyone will be listening along with you

Review Contents: Great price when I purchased gift for family member for Christmas.  Had never heard of the brand but it appeared to have good reviews for the most part.  Did not want to spend to much $$ and these included quite a number of features that some high end models had. The fit and comfort was perfect, easy to set up as well.  Great sound and comfort with adjustable band and keeps outside noise mostly out without the need to turn up volume.  Storage is great since headphones are foldable.  Also purchased Mpow transmitter and case.
Title: Great price when I purchased gift for family member for ...

Review Contents: Spent quite a bit if time researching headphones and these ones fit my requirements the best. I can say that the sound is pretty good, but the earpads in particular are very comfortable. I have a large head and ears and they fit quite comfortably. The Bluetooth buttons have a satisfying press and as other reviewers have indicated, appear to have little to no latency, which I can appreciate.Since I am new to ANC, I did not expect the eerie lack of background noise when I turned it off, and even regular voices were difficult to hear (a good thing). As expected, with ANC active, the sound quality decreases slightly, but really only results in a small amount of brighter fuzziness to the sound. Overall I am very happy with these headphones so far, and will be using them on an airplane this week to see how the ANC fares.
Title: ... researching headphones and these ones fit my requirements the best. I can say that the sound is pretty ...

Review Contents: These Bluetooth wireless headphones are very comfortable. I wore them at work for about 8 hours and never felt discomfort. The sound is perfect... Good bass and miss. Crisp highs. Haven't tried wired mode yet. I will when the battery dies :) which it hasn't yet. The other day on half battery left, it only took 1 hour to fully charge it. Nice set of cans here!
Title: Comfortable with great sound

Review Contents: Very comfortable and battery life seems to be good. My complaint is with the sound quality. Treble is not very clear and the bass is not existent. I have cheaper in ear Bluetooth headphones with more bass. I love the design and they seemed to be solidly built. I would love to give this more stars but the sound quality is not as good as expected.
Title: Decent headphones but muddy treble and disappointing bass prevent them from being great.

Review Contents: I got a pair of these back in Jan. and I absolutely love them! The sound quality is excellent, the fit is comfortable, the noise isolation is pretty good especially with music on, battery life is surprisingly good, I've gone a full week at times and used them fairly regularly without charging them, the design is slick and stylish. The only possible negative I could say about this product is that after extended periods of wearing them they do get uncomfortable, they also can get a bit hot but other than those two things they are just wonderful, especially for the price they are at.
Title: and I absolutely love them! The sound quality is excellent

Review Contents: As of now i have order many wireless earpod and headphones but this one is exceptional great in sound with good bass and crystal clear sound. I compared with this one sound quality with boss over the neck wireless earpord sound quality is exactly same. So i am strange about this in price range. Comfort is 10 out of 10. Sound quality i can give 9 of 10.Call quality I checked is good for office purposes by enabling noise canceling but in crowd place little bit background noise coming to opponent end for which i reached to customer care they will replace this. Amazing customer service very proactive and provide good resolution.
Title: Strong Bass with crystal clear sound excellent one

Review Contents: I gave these to my husband for Christmas, and he was excited to use them but what he's found is that although they provide good sound, they are extremely tight so they cause him headaches. Unfortunately, there is no way to loosen how tight the headphones fit; you can only lengthen them. The return window has closed so now they just sit, collecting dust. Pretty disappointing.
Title: Too tight; cause headaches

Review Contents: It was a gift for my niece and she said she wouldn't think of buying it for herself, but she is using it and found it helpful. She lives in a 3 story condo, and one afternoon had them on and received a call on her phone that she took on her headphones. Her phone was downstairs so it saved her the trip and probable missed call. She is enjoying them.
Title: It was a gift for my niece and she said ...

Review Contents: Received these as a gift.  They seem well-made, but the problem I run into is that the headband holds them so tightly to my head that I get headaches.  I don't have a huge head either.  After 30 minutes, without fail, I get a headache while wearing these, which makes them useless to me.  If they fit a little looser, I'd probably be giving them a 5-star review, as otherwise they seem to be put together very nicely and are a visually-pleasing design.
Title: Deal-breaker: These grip my head way too tightly and cause headaches

Review Contents: Update: They sent me a replacement unit that works well. I'm changing my rating based on the excellent customer service. I did not even ask for replacement yet they sent it. THANKS!!They worked really well for about 2 months, and now the wired connection isn't transmitting the sound at. Similar to other cheap brands, it's good for a short run, and will eventually crap out on you. I'm very dissapointed that I will once again have to shop for new headphones... sigh.
Title: 2 months in, and the wired connections is not working properly anymore

Review Contents: I got these as a Christmas gift and I was really pleased with them at first. I wore them to the gym because I kept losing smaller earbuds. I liked the sound quality and they stayed on my head pretty well with some minor adjusting during my weightlifting sessions. My biggest problem is that the ear pads soak up sweat. They are not removable so I can't take them off to wash. After trying several cleaning materials (including bleach) they still smell terrible. I've concluded I don't want to wear them to the gym anymore, which was the primary reason I wanted them. The power/pairing button is a little finicky, especially for powering off. The battery life is good; I can do several workouts throughout the week without needing to charge.
Title: ... these as a Christmas gift and I was really pleased with them at first

Review Contents: I bought a pair of these for myself and one for my elderly mother.  We both love them.  Sound is good.  Range is good.  My mother can walk all around her room (and probably farther) with no problem.  Interface is easy with my laptop and phone and with her desktop.  Battery life is excellent.  We have only had them a few days but we are both very happy with the purchase.
Title: Great For All Ages!

Review Contents: These fit great over my ears and I love the sound quality. Very sturdy feeling, without being too heavy, which is wonderful. I usually get headaches after wearing headphones for too long, but these are excellent. Battery has yet to run out, after several days of use. Extremely impressed with the quality for the price. Better than expected.
Title: Amazing quality for the price

Review Contents: (Blue/black 059) Been researching headphones, 2nd pair I've tried. So far they are are a hit. Arrived in less than 24 hrs, the box was a tad damaged, but headphones packed tightly in bubble wrap and appear undamaged. Fits well, my ear fits completely within the cushion and feels comfortable. Bluetooth connection took a few tries, could be that battery is low. Controls seem smooth, but can't tell which colors are flashing when wearing them unless you stand in front of a mirror. Got connected and charging now.
Title: Finally pleased with my purchase! Search is o'er.

Review Contents: I've had these headphones for a good 3 months now and they are my go to for everything, I use them on the plane, in the car, while watching a movie on my laptop, working out and everything else. Good quality and great sounding. The only one thing I would say is the cord is starting to malfunction so I'll have to buy another (I was probably abusing it a little though) but it doesn't matter because the bluetooth works really well and the charge lasts for ages.
Title: Great quality for low price.

Review Contents: My bf uses these for school and loves them! Waited a little bit to write a review as others said the blue tooth stopped working but his are still going strong. He loved that I got him his favorite color (green) and has utilized both wired for class and blue tooth for gym and said he really likes them. Would recommend
Title: Bought as a gift

Review Contents: I'm gonna be honest I bought these on a whim and I absolutely love them.I love it. They play loud enough for me to tune out anyone who wants to bother me when I'm out walking or just relaxing at home.I wear glasses and they feel just fine. I'm so glad I bought these. I've used them since I got them almost over a week ago and I still haven't needed to charge them. Like do these things even die? I fell asleep with them on and the bad boys are still going.
Title: Will not die.

Review Contents: These headphones were sent to me as a replacement for a bad pair that i got from mpow. But these are amazing! At $35 i would gladly pay for another pair. This is probably the best you can get at this price point. The sound is rich and and you can hear the bass and every instrument in the song. I havent tested these with phone calls yet, but i definilety have high hopes.
Title: ... were sent to me as a replacement for a bad pair that i got from mpow

Review Contents: I couldn't believe how good these sound for the price! They sounded as good as Beats.  They also fit all the way over the ear, they don't just sit on top of the ear, which is a fit that can be hard to find.  I also love that they fit comfortably with my glasses.  Definitely a great value for money!
Title: Sound Quality as Good as Higher End Headphones

Review Contents: Too loud on low and too tight on top of head and sides. I can attempt to adjust them all the way out and they are a little better but shouldn‚Äôt have to. Feels very cheap like it might break easy too. For the record my head is a small adult hat and my husband agrees too tight and too uncomfortable.
Title: Way too tight on my small head

Review Contents: I bought these to replace some other Bluetooth headphones my boyfriends 18yr old son had. He had the old ones taped together and they had seen better days. I saw these and thought he would like them, plus they came in green which he likes. He opened them up and his birthday and the smile on his face was priceless. He says they are amazing and he wears them all the time while at  home. They have good sound quality and fold up nicely and fit in the travel case that came with them great. I am happy that I purchased these. Thank you for making such a good product.
Title: He had the old ones taped together and they had seen better days. I saw these and thought he would ...

Review Contents: These are great headphones! Very comfortable, and the battery lasts a long time. One thing I really like about these is the sound quality, everything comes through very clearly, and even if I don't have anything playing through them I can hardly hear outside noises.
Title: Great pair of bluetooth headphones

Review Contents: I really loved everything about these, except for one thing. They leak sound like crazy. I like the controls on the side, they're comfortable, they hold battery well, the audio is decent, and they cancel noise coming into the headphones well. However, everyone in my office can hear what I'm listening to even on the lowest volume, so I can't use them. I guess you get what you pay for. I will be returning them for something nicer.
Title: Serious problems leaking sound

Review Contents: The first pair we got was awful. We were sent a different pair and they worked perfectly. I applaud their customer service for working with us so diligently. I would buy from them again. My husband is very happy with his new headphones. Thank you...
Title: Second pair- good, first pair-not so much

Review Contents: I am very satisfied with the people at Patozon. My initial purchase were the MPow Cheetah Bluetooth earbuds.Unfortunately the headphones did not fit and I was unable to enjoy the product comfortably. Patozon Customer  Service Department reached out to me and asked how the problem could be corrected. Long story short...I'm now enjoying my over the ear Bluetooth Headphones. I can now enjoy my workouts without getting tied up in wires or the buds falling out of my ears. The sound is amazing. Very durable product. I'm very pleased with this product.Great product. Great Customer Service.Satisfied CustomerSimona
Title: Great Product. Great Customer Service.

Review Contents: Original: Right ear speaker didn't work right off the bat. Returned.Update: Patozon gave me a full refund and sent me another pair on the house. So far they are working great. They are a bit tinny but they get the job done, and it's great to not have to deal with any cords. They fold compactly and are comfortable around the ears.This is nitpicky, but it would have been nice to have included a bluetooth dongle for those of us whose desktop PC's aren't bluetooth enabled. Not a huge deal, but would have been nice.4 stars for the great customer service.
Title: Original: Right speaker didn't work. Update: Company sent me a free pair and so far it works great.

Review Contents: These headphones live up to the hype. That said I've never owned a 300.00 pair but I'm pleased. I've been streamlining my desk. I had a Sony wireless (radio) headset that I used to use but I wanted less wires and plugs. It pairs great with the computer and my iPhone. There's also a  lady that lives inside that talks to you. " Pairing. Phone 1 connected"  But she says it real important like "Danger. Shields up" I love her. If you're looking for a good Bluetooth headset I highly recommend these.
Title: Great bluehtooth headset!

Review Contents: Purchased Mpow Bluetooth 2-in-1 Receiver/Transmitter, Wireless Bluetooth Adapter with Stereo Transmission, together with Mpow Bluetooth Headphones Over Ear, Hi-Fi Stereo Wireless Headset. Impressive sound and quality for the combined purchase of a little over $60.00. Effectively converted a 42-inch TV into a blue tooth device. Highly recommend both products and the Mpow /Patozon brand.
Title: Converted TV to a Bluetooth device with impressie sound and quality. Highly recommend!

Review Contents: These are great for the gym. Noise cancel very well and fit over my ears nicely. Only complaint is the Bluetooth cuts out if anything, even something like my arm, gets in the way of the direct path from my phone to my headset. This sucks sometimes for working out, but it doesn't happen enough to lower this to 4 stars. Sound quality is great too.
Title: Good buy!

Review Contents: At first these headphones were great, but after a couple of months the blue tooth keeps cutting out. Now they're barely usable because of how frequent this is happening.
Title: At first these headphones were great, but after a couple of months the blue ...

Review Contents: I boight these for my wife. Everything seemed great about them, the quality was good. The reviews were great, everything seemed fine.... That is until my home internet started going in and out. After some research, i found out that these headphones use the same radio frequency as my router. Once the headphones were off, my service was just fine. But once i turned them on i had connection issues with every device in my house.
Title: Wifi interference while using these headphones

Review Contents: These were bought as a gift but are on there way back because they look used. I spent a week going back and forth on emails to be told that the damaged foam doesn't influence the usage. They wanted me to accept damaged headphones and live with it. The design is horrible because the ear pieces fold and the one against the headband causes the foam to flatten out.
Title: Horrible customer service

Review Contents: I love them! I can listen to music, receive calls, answer my calls without holding the phone. They are great!Yesterday I was wearing them while working in the backyard. It was hot and I noticed that my ears were sweating. I wear hearing aids so I decided that next time I am wearing them with the same weather conditions I'm going to take off my hearing aids first.
Title: Excellent headphones

Review Contents: I think ‚Äúmeh‚Äù pretty much sums it up. They paired with my iPhone 8 just fine, and the controls were easy enough to operate. They felt a bit flimsy, and the sound wasn‚Äôt up to par. They did block out outside noise pretty well.They were fairly cheep, so I don‚Äôt feel ripped off. In the end I‚Äôve decided to give them away as gifts and look for a better pair for myself.
Title: Meh

Review Contents: I was in love with these until today. The connection with my laptop is cutting in and out, disrupting the music I'm trying to listen to while I work. It doesn't matter if it's playing on Spotify, YouTube or Bandcamp. It's not a buffering issue, it's a connection issue. Someone, HELP! My computer is not on WiFi anymore, I connected it to the internet via Ethernet, no other Bluetooth devices are connected to my computer. What's up with this connection? I received these for Christmas and this is only my 2nd day using them.
Title: I was in love, until today

Review Contents: Sound is fantastic but the mic doesn't work too well.  Mic picks up your neighbor in the next cube better than you.  Fine if there is low ambient noise.  Also after a while they do get a bit heavy and tiresome on the ears.
Title: Sound is fantastic but the mic doesn't work too well

Review Contents: I got these for Christmas and they are by far the best headphones I have ever had, I used to think that apple headphones had unbeatable sound but these topped them easily, the sound is so crisp and perfect. The aux cable broke and I have to buy a new one, the headphones hold a charge for an extremely long time it is unbelievable. The microphone is not good at all, but that is a fair price to pay for excellent sound. The headphones are also very comfortable to wear.I would recommend these to anyone that is crazy about perfect sound
Title: best Christmas gift ever!!!!!

Review Contents: As good as Beats by Dre (R)!  I bought a pair for my gf and ended up basically stealing them so I had to buy another pair for myself!  We now have 2 pairs and may buy more as gifts for friends.  GREAT quality for the price and noise cancellation is awesome
Title: As good as Beats by Dre (R)!

Review Contents: Headphones would not connect to my PC/play sound from my PC, even after hours of troubleshooting and fiddling with settings. Since this was why I bought them, it was a deal-breaker. Connected them to my phone just to make sure they worked, sound quality was pretty bad, significantly worse than the $5 headphones I plug into the audio jack. I don't know if it was just the combination of my phone with the headset, but it didn't really matter since I got them for my PC. I will be looking elsewhere.
Title: sound quality was pretty bad, significantly worse than the $5 headphones I ...

Review Contents: Great headphones for the priceI hate the ear plugs, over the ear is much betterQuality of the set is greatIf I wear it for long term, my ears hurt a little (but that may be just me)Bass is ok, mids and highs are very good.Noice cancelling works good too.
Title: Great headphones for the price I hate the ear plugs

Review Contents: I got these headphones after looking for a while for some Bluetooth headphones and, I'll say this, they're definitely worth the 40 or so dollars I paid. They're not super great or anything, the sound is fine, but you'll get a lot of mids, which you can balance out on your phone's EQ in the settings. I'm happy with them, battery life seems good. I have only had one issue which is when my phone screen locks, the music will stutter, but that might be my phone, who knows. If you wanna spend 120 on headphones, you'll definitely get better sound, but these are totally fine.
Title: Perfectly Adequate

Review Contents: Been looking at some Bluetooth headphones for awhile that were not too expensive, comfortable, good battery life and of course great sound quality. I am happily surprised by these headphones and the quality exceeded my expectations. I payed full price for these and was not disappointed. The quality seems better when directly plugged in, particularly the bass but not enough to be bothered by it. Overall pleased with this product.
Title: Pleasantly surprised

Review Contents: Opened and immediately returned. Earcups don't fit over my adult ears. They are very narrow ovals, almost look like child size headphones.
Title: Earcups are TINY

Review Contents: The sound is not good my 5 dollars earbuds is better. The hands free function when paired with phone fails intermittent. They cant hear you.updated.I gave 2 more stars , because costumer service went beyond to resolve my issues. never experienced this from any seller in amazon.
Title: The sound is not good my 5 dollars earbuds is better

Review Contents: The sound is not good my 5 dollars earbuds is better. The hands free function when paired with phone fails intermittent. They cant hear you.updated.I gave 2 more stars , because costumer service went beyond to resolve my issues. never experienced this from any seller in amazon.
Title: The sound is not good my 5 dollars earbuds is better

Review Contents: I purchased these as a birthday gift for my brother who requested a pair of headphones. They're very comfy and he loves them and uses them daily! He also loves that he can fold them and out them in his backpack.
Title: A+ College Student Headphones

Review Contents: Love the headphones they work great i almost all situations. Phone, music, etc work great.  I bought them for work because I work on headsets all day long and for whatever reason the mic will not work with the computer. the sound from the phone calls on the computer work great but I have to hang my old headphones around my neck..So uncomfortable and is stopping me from giving a 5 star rating and getting my kids a pair.
Title: Mic doesn't work on my computer

Review Contents: The two critiques I have are:The tilt to the headphones when you put them on straight. Makes it have to be out on a little akwardly to the back of your head.And the one button does too many things. You end up having to use the same button for all functions.
Title: Almost 100%

Review Contents: Not good quality headphone
Title: No brand name

Review Contents: It has only been a little more than a  week, but I do enjoy these head phones.  I had put them on my Amazon Wish List know that if I had asked for high end ones...I would not get them.  For the money, they are proving to be a great gift. I had no problem pairing with my iPhone5S.
Title: Decent Headphone Value

It's not unbearable, but I can only wear them for a few hours before the top of my head gets sore.Like others have reported, the microphone doesn't pick up much and should definitely only be used in quiet environments.
